member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditEntry
member.summary: Presents an entry in the Audit Trail system. This entry stores the information regarding what entity was modified, which user worked on the entity, and what type of action was performed on that entity.
member.example:
AuditEntry is retrieved from AuditTrail by its ID.
IAuditEntry entry = store.AuditTrail.Entry("AuditEntries/8321");

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditEntry.Serialize
member.summary: Returns the entry's XML presentation.
member.returns: The XML presentation of this audit entry.
member.example:
The following is an example of a serialization result:
<AuditEntry Time="20130815T10:31:03"> <User UserID="ingeniux\awang" Name="Arn Maeda" /> <Entity ID="x265" Name="Contact Us", Type="Ingeniux.CMS.Page" /> <Description>Create or Update</Description> </AuditEntry>

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditEntry.Time
member.summary: Gets the time of this entry.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditEntry.User
member.summary: Gets the user who performs the action.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditEntry.ActionDescription
member.summary: Gets the description of the action performed on the entity.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditEntry.Entity
member.summary: Gets the entity on which the action was performed.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditTrail
member.summary: Represents the Audit Trail system. This system allows you to retrieve audit entries and add new entries. The Audit Trail system automatically creates entries after entities are created, updated, or deleted in the content store.

remarks.para: The Audit Trail interface is only created once per ContentStore instance. It is not controlled within any UserSession, and its updates aren't involved in any transactions.
The Audit Trail interface doesn't allow for removal of entries, but it does perform automatic archives based on its settings.

member.example:
The Audit Trail instance is retrieved directly from the ContentStore.
IAuditTrail auditTrail = store.AuditTrail;

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditTrail.Add``1(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,``0,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new Audit Entry for an entity update.
member.param: User performing the action
Entity being modified
Description of action

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditTrail.Entries(System.Int32@,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves audit entries in a paginated fashion.
member.param: Output total count of audit entries
Filtering operating user
Lower end of the time range for audit entries
Upper end of the time range for audit entries
Number of entries to return; if not provided, returns all entries
Starting index of entries; if not provided, starts from first entry
member.returns: Collection of audit entries

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAuditTrail.EntityUpdateEntries``1(System.Int32@,``0,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves audit entries that record entity updates in a paginated fashion.
member.param: Outputs total count of audit entries
Filtering operating user
Lower and of the time range for audit entries
Upper end of the time range for audit entries
Number of entries to return; if not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries; if not provided, start from first entry.
member.returns: Collection of audit entries

member.param: Audit trail ID
member.returns: Audit trail with matching ID; if it doesn't exist, returns null.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ContentStore
member.summary: The entry object to Ingeniux Content Store API. It is in charge of creating all communication sessions with the content store. This object should only be created once per app domain.
member.remarks: For detailed members information, please refers to the interfaces IContentStore and IUserInit.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStore
member.summary: Represents the object that hosts the content of a CMS instance. There should be only one instance of this object created per App Domain. For a CMS Site, this object is always stored as an application variable that persists throughout the CMS application's lifecycle. Any integration work at the CSAPI level should only use one ContentStore instance per App Domain.
member.remarks: Please refers to for details of how to retrieve a ContentStore instance from ASP.NET application variables.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStoreEvents
member.summary: Content store events: The content store subscribes to all the events below and relays event firings to the corresponding managers or objects.
member.remarks: Content store events are a collection of events fired by different managers. Managers include their own share of events. The content store subscribes to the events fired by each manager and fires a corresponding event with the same name. Therefore, subscribing to content store events also subscribes to all manager events.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IEntityEvents
member.summary: Represents the collection of Entity events.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IEntityEvents.BeforeEntitySave
member.summary: This event is fired before any Entity object is about to be saved.
member.remarks: This event covers all entity objects, including pages, users, workflows, and publishing targets.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IEntityEvents.AfterEntitySave
member.summary: This event is fired after a Entity object is saved.
member.remarks: This event will covers all entity objects, including pages, users, workflows, and publishing targets. This event is fired when the object is saved to the content store.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTargetEvents
member.summary: Represent the collection of Publishing Target events.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTargetEvents.BeforePublishingTargetMarkForPublishChange
member.summary: This event is fired before any Publishing Target is marked for publish, unmarked for publish, or has its marking version changed.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTargetEvents.AfterPublishingTargetMarkForPublishChange
member.summary: This event is fired after any Publishing Target is marked for publish, unmarked for publish, or has its marking version changed.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTargetEvents.BeforePublish
member.summary: This event is fired before a Publishing Task is submitted.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTargetEvents.Published
member.summary: This event is fired after a Publishing Task is completed.
member.remarks: This event is fired in the background publishing thread.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTaskEvents
member.summary: Represents the collection of Publishing Task events

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTaskEvents.BeginPublish
member.summary: This event is fired when a publish starts.
member.remarks: This event is not fired when a Publishing Task is submited; it's fired when the Publishing Task actually starts.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTaskEvents.PublishComplete
member.summary: This event is fired when a Publishing Task finishes executing.
member.remarks: This event is fired at the same time as a publish event, but it is for a different purpose.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTaskEvents.PublishStepAdvanced
member.summary: This event is fired when Publishing Task advances to next step (e.g., when a publish task finishes copying images).

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTaskEvents.PublishStepUpdated
member.summary: This event is fired when a Publishing Task finishes publishing one Page.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTaskEvents.PublishingErrorOccurred
member.summary: This event is fired when any error occurrs during Publishing Task execution.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageEvents.AfterPageCheckOut

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageEvents.AfterPageCheckIn

member.summary: This event is fired after a page undo check-out.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageEvents.AfterPageAssign

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStore.OpenReadSession(Ingeniux.CMS.IReadonlyUser)
member.summary: Opens a read-only session. This session doesn't track changes to objects that were retrieved within this session, nor does it track created or deleted objects. It is not in charge of saving changes, only for reading.
member.param: The user to open the session.
member.returns: The read-only session.
member.remarks: This session throws an error upon disposal, when any of the objects loaded within it changes, or when trying to add or remove objects.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStore.OpenWriteSession(Ingeniux.CMS.IReadonlyUser)
member.summary: Opens a read/write session. This session automatically tracks changes made to any objects that were retrieved within this session. It also tracks the newly created and to-be-deleted objects. All saves occur when the session is disposed. If any exceptions occurred before the session is closed, no changes are applied. This system makes it easy to perform transactional changes and prevents any partial changes due to errors before the session is disposed.
member.param: The user to open the session. All changes must occur via this user account.
member.returns: The read/write session.
member.remarks: The best way to open a session is to use the "using" statement, ensuring it is always disposed properly. If not, make sure to manually dispose the instance.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStore.GetStartingUser(System.String,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Gets a starting User object to open a session.
member.remarks: It is good idea to keep this object around, since all session openings need a starting user, and retrieving it every time is will waste of bandwidth.
member.param: The unique ID of the user to retrieve
member.exception: User doesn't exist in ContentStore.
member.returns: The read-only User object. This User object is only for creating sessions; you cannot make changes to this object.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStore.GetAttachment(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a binary attachment from the ContentStore.
member.remarks: Binary attachments are not indexed in the ContentStore and don't require a session to retrieve.
member.param: Unique ID of the attachment binary to retrieve.
member.returns: Retrieved attachment. Null if attachment doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStore.PutAttachment(Ingeniux.CMS.IContentAttachment)
member.summary: Saves an attachment to the ContentStore.
member.remarks: Binary attachment saving doesn't require a session and therefore is not protected by transactions.
member.param: The attachment to save to the ContentStore

Binary attachment saving doesn't require a session and therefore is not protected by transactions.

member.param: Unique ID of the attachment to remove

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ContentStore.OpenWriteSession(Ingeniux.CMS.IReadonlyUser)
member.summary: Opens a read/write session. This session will automatically track changes made to any objects that were retrieved within this session. It will also track the newly created and to be deleted objects. All saves are done when the session is disposed. If any exceptions occurred in the middle before the session is closed, none of the saves will happen. This system make it easy to perform transactional changes, prevently any partial changes due to errors in the middle.
member.param: The user to open the session. All changes will be done via this user account.
member.returns: The read/write session.
member.remarks: The best way to open a session is to use the "using" statement, ensure it is always disposed properly. If not, make sure to manually dispose the instance.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ContentStore.OpenReadSession(Ingeniux.CMS.IReadonlyUser)
member.summary: Opens a readonly session. This session will not track any changes to objects that were retrieved within this session, nor will it track any created or deleted objects. It is not in charge of saving changes, only for reading.
member.param: The user to open the session.
member.returns: The readonly session
member.remarks: This session will throw error upon disposal, when any of the objects loaded within is changes, or when trying to add or remove objects.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IComponentElement.Embed(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary:
Embeds a component. The component can be an existing Page object or newly creately that hasn't been save to Content Store yet.
For an component created from scratch, "Id" attributes will be empty, since the embedded component doesn't need its own identification.
member.param: The component to embed. Can be an existing component (with Id), or new component not saved yet (without Id). It is OK to allow the embedded component to be a Page with View or Template
member.remarks: It is allowed for embedded component to embed another component. The new embed component will replace the old one.
member.exception: When "componentContentToEmbed" parameter is null value
When component has CompTypes limitations, and the content schema is not in the list.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IComponentElement.Embed(Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion)
member.summary:
Embeds a component. The component can be an existing Page Version object or newly creately that hasn't been save to Content Store yet.
For an component Page Version created from scratch, "Id" attributes will be empty, since the embedded component doesn't need its own identification.
member.param: The component to embed. Can be an existing component (with XID), or new component not saved yet (without XID). It is OK to allow the embedded component to be a Page with View or Template
member.remarks: It is allowed for embedded component to embed another component. The new embed component will replace the old one.
member.exception: When "componentContentToEmbed" parameter is null value
When component has CompTypes limitations, and the content schema is not in the list.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IComponentElement.Share(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean,Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion)
member.summary: Unembeds the content off the component and turn it into an actual Page object and place it under the given root.
member.param: Root page to place the extracted component under
Specifies whether or not to place the component at the root page's children. Default is to place in the front.
The page version content to replace the embed content of this component. When specified, this content will be used to create the shared component instead.
member.returns: The extracted component, null if component is not in embedded mode
member.exception: When root page is null
When current user doesn't have rights, or user doesn't have write access to root page node

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IComponentElement.ShareBack(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession,System.Boolean,Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion)
member.summary: Unembeds the content off the component and save it back to the original component. This process requires the embedded/override content to have the same schema as the its original component.
member.param: The session to use to retrieve original component
Whether to check in the original component automatically, after share back.
The page version content to replace the embed content of this component. When specified, this content will be used to create the shared component instead.
member.exception: When component doesn't have the original component id, or original component no longer exists
When current user doesn't have rights, or user doesn't have write access to the original component

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IExportElement
member.summary: Represents a local export entry in Navigation and Link elements. Defines an additional XML attribute to be included in an page element's output.
member.example:
When a new export entry with the name "Abstract" and value "Abstract" is added, the navigation entry element should look like the following:
<Page ID="x454" URL="about-us/news-and-events/motorola-employees-credit-union-selects-ingeniux" Date="20040111T00:00:00" Changed="20130515T20:47:10" CategoryIds="133" Locale="" Schema="NewsDetail" Name="Motorola Employees Credit Union Selects Ingeniux" Abstract="MECU Licenses Ingeniux CMS to Power Internet and Intranet sites" Title="Motorola Employees Credit Union Selects Ingeniux CMS" />
To create a new ExportElement:
IExportElement exportEntry = new ExportElement("Title", "/*/Title");
Serialization output matches the local export's entry value from a Navigation element in previous-generation CMS content. The difference that is the output is escaped in an ExportsElement's serialization.
<Export><Name>Title</Name><Value>/*/Title</Value></Export>

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IExportElement.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the export's name. This name must be a valid XML element name.
member.exception: When name value is null, empty, or contains whitespace
When name value is not a valid XML element name

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IExportElement.Query
member.summary: Gets and sets the query expression of the export.
member.example:
Query expression must be a valid XPath expression. Below are a few examples:
"Abstract" The element named "Abstract" under the root element. "/*/Abstract" The element named "Abstract" under the root element. "//Abstract" The element named "Abstract" that is descendant of the root element at any level. This makes for a recursive search that is much slower. "/*/@Timeout The "Timeout" attribute of the root element. "/*/FlashSlideshowComponent/Flash/@URL The URL attribute of the Flash element, under the FlashSlideshowComponent element, under the root element.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IExportsElement
member.summary: Represents the collection of local export entries in Navigation and Link elements. Defines an additional XML attribute to be included in a Page element's output.

example.para: ExportsElement can be found by the property of a Navigation element. Navigation and Link elements always have this property, which is never a null object:
Serialization output matches the Exports element under NavigationElements in previous-generation CMS content. The entries in the collection serialization output are escaped to a string.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IExportsElement.Exports

member.returns: All export entries in the collection.

member.summary: Adds a new export entry to the collection.
member.param: New export entry to add
member.remarks: If the "export" parameter is null, this method does nothing.
member.exception: When there is already an export entry that has the same name.

member.param: Export entry to remove

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IExportsElement.ClearExports

member.exception: When the exportsValue string is not a well-formed collection of export entry XML elements.

summary.para: Represents a Group element on a page.
A Group element contains child elements of any type, except another group element.

remarks.para: In a schema, a group element consists of two pieces: GroupStart and GroupEnd. The children of Group element on a page are the elements between the GroupStart and GroupEnd tags.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.ChildItems
member.summary: Retrieves this group's child elements collection.
member.returns: Collection of child elements.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.AddChildItem(Ingeniux.CMS.IElement)
member.summary: Adds a new child element.
member.param: New child element to add
member.remarks: This method cannot be called after Close is called.
member.exception: Calling this method on Group element that is Closed.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.ChildItemsCount
member.summary: Gets the count of child elements.
member.returns: Count of child elements.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.Close
member.summary: Closes the group element, preventing the addition of child elements.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.Enclosed
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the rendering of the group element at runtime or preview will be wrapped in a wrapper element.
member.remarks: This is new to CMS 9.0. Previous versions remove the Group element during expansion.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.AllowEnclosureChange
member.summary: Gets whether changing the Enclosed property is allowed on the element.
member.remarks: This property is set by schema at page creation and cannot be changed afterward. Default is false.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IGroupElement.Closed
member.summary: Gets whether the group is closed. You cannot add child elements to a closed group.

summary.para: Represents the types of XPower elements that produce a collection of Navigation elements during runtime or publishing expansion. A Navigation element queries each page it covers and produces a Page element with a set of attributes that summarizes the page's content.
The highly organized and highly flexible Navigation elements are a central part of the Ingeniux CMS.

The amount of information to summarize from page content is decided by the combination of global exports and local exports. Local exports override global exports with same name. Therefore, all Navigation element types can have local exports.

example.para: Each Navigation element's page output will look something like the following example:
example.code: <Page ID="x454" URL="about-us/news-and-events/motorola-employees-credit-union-selects-ingeniux" Date="20040111T00:00:00" Changed="20130515T20:47:10" CategoryIds="133" Locale="" Schema="NewsDetail" Name="Motorola Employees Credit Union Selects Ingeniux" Abstract="MECU Licenses Ingeniux CMS to Power Internet and Intranet sites" Title="Motorola Employees Credit Union Selects Ingeniux CMS" />

remarks.para: It is highly recommended to use gloabal exports whenever possible, because using local exports is much slower. An exception is when override is desired on global export entries, or you are trying to query expanded Link elements.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.INavigationElement.LocalExports
member.summary: Gets the element's local exports.
member.remarks: The return of this property will not be null.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage

summary.para: Represents a node in the content tree within a particular Site. It can be retrieved via Page method from the Site object.

Pages are the building blocks of a CMS Site. Each Page object represents a structured piece of content that represents either a URL on the runtime site or a content block to be included in other pages.

member.example:
Example of page serialization output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Details ID="x9" Name="Terms" IsComponent="false" ViewName="Details"> <Title type="string" UID="df5fea71-5d6a-4cd0-a1f1-bc21c7d2e628" label="Title" readonly="false" hidden="true" required="false">Terms of Service</Title> <BodyCopy type="xhtml" UID="2d1c3d20-b7ee-42c6-87d9-5edeacabd31a" label="Body Copy" readonly="true" hidden="false" required="false" Height=""> Fusce condimentum eleifend enim a feugiat. Pellentesque viverra vehicula sem ut volutpat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut non libero magna. Sed et quam lacus. Fusce condimentum eleifend enim a feugiat. </BodyCopy> <xPower Type="Component" Name="SiteControl" Component="x4" UID="5eacaa24-b25a-4a3a-b38c-ecf2ae2dc241" label="ç½‘ç«™é€šç”¨å†…å®¹" readonly="false" hidden="false" required="false" CompTypes="SiteControl" WrappedUp="" AllowWrappingChange="false" componentName="SiteControl" AutoEmbed="false" Embedded="false" /> <xPower Type="Navigation" Name="AncestorNavigation" Navigation="Ancestors" UID="d206ba6f-9fca-4e3e-bbf1-151948d7ccd1" label="Ancestor Navigation" readonly="false" hidden="false" required="false" Expanded="false" GenerationOrder="down" StartPage="x2" MaxNodes="" MaxDepth="" Query="" /> <IGX_Presentations> <DefaultPresentations /> <MobilePresentations /> </IGX_Presentations> </Details>

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion
member.summary: Represents the content of a Page at a specific stage in the page's history. The Page Version object contains Elements and Attributes on the page content, the Presentations of the Page, and references to the page and its Schema Version.

remarks.para: A page contains at least one page version instance, the current version. If the page is checked out, it also contains the check-out version. If the page was previously checked in, it will contain one or more previous versions.

member.example:
Example of PageVersion serialization output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Details ID="x9" Name="Terms" IsComponent="false" ViewName="Details"> <Title type="string" UID="df5fea71-5d6a-4cd0-a1f1-bc21c7d2e628" label="Title" readonly="false" hidden="true" required="false">Terms of Service</Title> <BodyCopy type="xhtml" UID="2d1c3d20-b7ee-42c6-87d9-5edeacabd31a" label="Body Copy" readonly="true" hidden="false" required="false" Height=""> Fusce condimentum eleifend enim a feugiat. Fusce condimentum eleifend enim a feugiat. </BodyCopy> <xPower Type="Component" Name="SiteControl" Component="x4" UID="5eacaa24-b25a-4a3a-b38c-ecf2ae2dc241" label="ç½‘ç«™é€šç”¨å†…å®¹" readonly="false" hidden="false" required="false" CompTypes="SiteControl" WrappedUp="" AllowWrappingChange="false" componentName="SiteControl" AutoEmbed="false" Embedded="false" /> <xPower Type="Navigation" Name="AncestorNavigation" Navigation="Ancestors" UID="d206ba6f-9fca-4e3e-bbf1-151948d7ccd1" label="Ancestor Navigation" readonly="false" hidden="false" required="false" Expanded="false" GenerationOrder="down" StartPage="x2" MaxNodes="" MaxDepth="" Query="" /> <IGX_Presentations> <DefaultPresentations /> <MobilePresentations /> </IGX_Presentations> </Details>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.Element(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an Element by its name.
member.param: Name of the elements to retrieve. Case-sensitive.
member.returns: Element with matching name. Returns null if no element matches the name.

remarks.para: A good Schema makes sure that no two elements, except the elements in a List element, have the same name.
If there happens be multiple elements with the same name, this method returns the first element from the top.
This method doesn't have child elements of List, Group, or Embedded Component.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.MarkForPublish(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marks this page version for publish on the specified Publishing Target
member.param: Publishing target to mark this on which to mark this page version.
Whether to include descendants of the Page to which this page version belongs.
Whether to mark or unmark for publish.

remarks.para: When "mark" is true, and "recursive" is true, this is not a page version marked for publish, but pages marked for publish.
The Page to which this page version belongs and its descendants are marked on the Publishing Target,
with their latest version.
When "mark" is true and "recursive" is false, then it is this page version's version number marked on the publishing target.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.AddElement(Ingeniux.CMS.IElement[])
member.summary: Adds one or multiple elements to the Elements collection.
member.param: Elements to be added to the collection

remarks.para: The elements added to the collection become direct children of the page version.
The new child elements are appended to the elements collection.
Any null items in the collection are ignored.
If an element to be added has the same ID as an existing element, an error is thrown.

member.exception: When any element to add has the same unique ID as an existing element.

The anchor element before which to insert the element(s)

remarks.para: The elements added to the collection become direct children of the page version.
The new child elements are added the elements collection in front of the anchor element.
Any null items in the collection are ignored.
If any element to add has the same unique ID as an existing element, an error is thrown.

member.exception: When any element to add has the same unique ID as an existing element.

remarks.para: The elements added to the collection become direct children of the page version.
The new child elements will be added the elements collection in front of the anchor element.
Any null items in the collection are ignored.
If any element to add has the same unique ID as an existing element, an error is thrown.

member.exception: When any element to add has the same unique ID as an existing element.

member.summary: Gets the version number of this page version.

member.summary: Gets the date and time when this page version was last changed.

member.summary: Gets the Page to which this page version belongs.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.SchemaVersion
member.summary: Gets the Schema Version this on which this page version is based. It could be based on a previous version of the Schema.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.Presentations
member.summary: Gets and sets the Presentations of this page version. This value is null by default, meaning there is no presentation for rendering in Page Builder mode.

remarks.para: Presentations are runtime rendering of a Page, but stored as a data model instead of markup.
It is the bridge between Ingeniux CMS' structured content and easy rendering customization without development.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.SchemaName
member.summary: Gets the root name of the Schema, which is also the root element name of this page version's serialized XML document.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.ViewName
member.summary: Gets and sets this page version's ViewName.

remarks.para: ViewName refers of the name of the this page's view at runtime in an MVC development environment.
This property instructsthe Dynamic Site Server to select the view when rendering this page at runtime.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion.Layout
member.summary: Gets and sets the page version's layout, which is the file name of its XSLT style sheet.

remarks.para: Layout serves as backup rendering mechanism when ViewName is not specified or cannot be found.

member.example: Example of Layout value: "default.xsl"

member.summary: Retrieves the descendants of this page within the given depth limit.
member.param: Total count of all descendant pages within the given depth limit

The depth limit of descendants, relative of this page's hierarchy level. A maxDepth value of 2 means to retrieve the descendants that are within 2 levels below the given page. A maxDepth of 0 means to retrieve all descendants.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of descendant pages within the depth limit

The depth limit of descendants, relative of this page's hierarchy level. A maxDepth value of 2 means to retrieve the descendants that are within 2 levels below the given page. A maxDepth of 0 means to retrieve all descendants.
member.returns: Collection of metadata of descendant pages within the depth limit

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.RegionRoot
member.summary: Retrieves the Locale (language) root of this page.
member.returns: Region root page of this page. If this page itself is a region root, returns itself.

remarks.para: Language root pages refers to pages that have Languages explicitly specified. When a page has a specific language, its descendants will inherit the same language and use this page as the language root.
If the page doesn't have any Language setting, then this method returns null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckedInPage
member.summary: Retrieves the checked-in content of this page. If the page is checked out, there could be potential differences between the content of the page and result of this method.
member.returns: The content of the checked-in version of this page.
member.remarks: When a page is just created from its Schema, the content of the checked-in page is the original default or empty content from the schema.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CloneLingualMaps(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the lingual maps between this page and its clone pages.
member.param: Total count of all clone pages.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.

member.returns: Collection of this page's clone maps. If this page has no clone pages, this method returns an empty collection.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CloneLingualMapsCount
member.summary: Returns the count of all clone lingual maps.
member.returns: Count of all clone maps. Returns 0 if the page has no clone pages.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Rollback
member.summary: Reverts a page's content to that of its latest previous Version.

remarks.para: If the page was never checked in before, an error will be thrown.
This method can be called on both checked-in and checked-out pages. Either way, after executing the method, the page will in the checked in state.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: "BeforePageRollback" and "AfterPageRollback"

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckInSingleWithNoValidate(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget})
member.summary: Checks in the page itself without applying validations before check-in.
member.param: Collection of publishing targets on which to check in this page. These publishing targets will mark the page on its latest version. If not specified, no publishing target will mark the page on its latest version.
member.remarks: Check-in validations are in place to make sure that the content of checked-in pages meets the criteria to be ready for publishing. Therefore, use this method only when necessary.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckInSingleWithNoValidateOnProfile(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingProfile)
member.summary: Checks in the page itself, without applying validations before check-in, toward the Publishing Targets included in the Publishing Profile.
member.param: The publishing profile that includes publishing targets toward which to check in the page. If not specified, no publishing target will have marking changed on this page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckIn(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks in either the page itself or the page and its descendants.
member.param: Collection of publishing targets toward which to check in this page. These publishing targets mark the page on its latest version. If not specified, no publishing target will change marking on this page.
Specifies whether to also check in the descendants of this page.
member.returns: Count of pages operated on

remarks.para: If the page was already checked in, the operation will continue to check in descendants and mark the page's latest version on provided publishing targets.
The current user must have the permission to check in and check out pages. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
The current user must have Full Access to this page. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
If the page is not assigned to the current user and the current user doesn't have to right to check in other user's pages, an error will be thrown.
If the page contains required Elements that don't have values filled in, an error will be thrown.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageCheckIn and AfterPageCheckIn.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckInOnProfile(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingProfile,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks in either the page itself or the page and its descendants toward the Publishing Targets included in the Publishing Profile.
member.param: The publishing profile that includes the publishing targets toward which to check in the page. If not specified, no publishing target will mark the page on its latest version.
Specifies whether to also check in the descendants of this Page together.

remarks.para: If the page was already checked in, the operation will continue to check in descendants and mark the page's latest version on the publishing targets included in the publishing profile.
The current user must have permission to check in and check out pages. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
The current user must have Full Access to this page. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
If the page is not assigned to the current user and the current user doesn't have to right to check in other user's pages, an error will be thrown.
If the page contains required Elements that don't have values filled in, an error will be thrown.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageCheckIn and AfterPageCheckIn.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckOut(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks out the page and assigns it to the current user. A page can only be edited after it is checked out to the current user.
member.param: Specifies whether to also check out the descendants of this page.
member.returns: Count of pages operated over

remarks.para: If a page was already checked out, this method will continue to check out descendants. If not a recursive operation, nothing will happen.
The current user must have permission to check in and check out pages. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
The current user must have Full Access to this page. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
If the page was assigned to another user and the current user doesn't have the right to assign a page, an error will be thrown.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageCheckOut and AfterPageCheckOut.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.UndoCheckOut(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Discards the changes in checked-out content and reverts the page to a checked-in state.
member.param: Specifies whether to also undo check out on the descendants of this page.

remarks.para: If page wasn't checked out, nothing will happen.
The current user must have permission to check in and check out pages. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
The current user must have Full Access to this page. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
If the page is not assigned to the current user and the current user doesn't have the right to check in other users' pages, an error will be thrown.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageUndoCheckOut and AfterPageUndoCheckOut.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CreateChildPage(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new child page under the current page.
member.param: Name of the new child page to create.
Schema to be used to create the child Page. If not specified, error will be thrown.
Specified whether to create the child page as the first child or last child.
member.returns: Newly created child page

remarks.para: If the current user doesn't have the permission to create pages, an error will be thrown.
If a schema is not provided, an error will be thrown.
If the parentPage value is the Recycle Folder, an error will be thrown.
If the current user doesn't have Full Access to this page, an error will be thrown.
The event "PageCreated" will be fired upon child page creation.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.RemoveChildPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Removes a child Page of this page.
member.param: The child page to removed. If not provided, this method returns false.

remarks.para: If a child page isn't provided or that page is not child of this page this method returns false.
The current user must have permission to Delete pages. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
The current user must have Full Access to this page. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
If the page is not assigned to the current user and the current user doesn't have to right to assign other users' pages, an error will be thrown.
Two events are fired by this method on the page to be removed: BeforePageDelete and AfterPageDelete

member.returns: True if the child page is successfully removed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SecurityGroups(Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumNodeLevelPermission,System.Boolean)

member.param: Level of access by which to filter groups. Groups with an equal or higher access level are returned.
Specifies whether to return groups with an equal or higher access levels or only groups with equal access levels.
member.returns: Collection of groups that match the criteria. Empty collection if no matches.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SetSecurityGroup(Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumNodeLevelPermission,Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Sets the access level to this page for a specific User Group. Successful execution of this method causes the SecurityInherited property to be set to false.

User group to set access level for on this page

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.RemoveSecurityGroup(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Removes the access rights of a given user group to this page.
member.param: User Group whose access is to be removed
member.returns: True if given user group's access is successfully removed. Otherwise, returns false.

If the Group parameter is not provided, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.ClearSecurity
member.summary: Clears all access to this page. Note that if no further security setting procedures are taken, no one except administrators will have access to this page . This action permenantly removes the security descriptor for this page.
member.returns: Returns true if this page has a security descriptor. It returns false otherwise.

remarks.para: If this page's security is inherited, no action occurs and the method returns false.

member.summary: Checks whether the given user was granted the specified access level.

The access level
member.returns: True if the User has equal or higher access level, false if the user doesn't.

member.summary: Sets value for a system attribute.

New system attribute object

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SetSystemAttribute(Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumSystemAttributes,System.String)

member.param: Enum value of the system attribute to set
New system attribute string value

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AssignUser(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns this page to a specific User.
member.param: User to whom to assign the page
Comments for this assignment action

remarks.para: If the user parameter is null, this is an unassign operation.
If the page currently assigned to a Group, the new user must be a member of this group. Only administrators are allowed to assign this page to a user that is not a member of the Assigned Group.
When the page is not in a Workflow, the comment specified will be set on the page itself in the AssignmentComment property.
When the page is in a workflow, the specified user must be a member of the CurrentGroup of the workflow. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageAssign, and AfterPageAssign.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AssignGroup(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns this page to a specific User Group.
member.param: User group to which to assign the page
Comments for this assignment action

remarks.para: If the group parameter is null, this is an unassign operation.
When a page is not in a Workflow, the comment specified will be set on the page itself into the AssignmentComment property.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageAssign, and AfterPageAssign.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.ClaimPageForCurrentUser
member.summary: Assigns the Page to the current operating User.

remarks.para: This method call requires that the page be assigned to a User Group and that the current user be a member of that group. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AddToWorkflow(Ingeniux.CMS.IWorkflowDefinition,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Adds this page to workflow. This operation creates a new workflow instance for this page based on the Workflow Definition provided and assigns the page to the specified User.
member.param: Definition of the workflow to create the workflow instance
User to assign the page to after it is added to workflow
member.returns: The newly created workflow instance.

remarks.para: If this page is already in a workflow, it is first removed from that workflow.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AddToWorkflowDefault(Ingeniux.CMS.IWorkflowDefinition)
member.summary: Adds this page to a workflow. If the initial Transition has a Default User specified, the page will be assigned to that user. Otherwise, it will be assigned to the Next Group specified by the transition. This operation creates a new workflow instance for this page based on the Workflow Definition provided.
member.param: Definition of the Workflow to create the workflow instance
User to assign the page to after it is added to workflow
member.returns: The newly created workflow instance.

remarks.para: If this Page is already in a workflow, it is first removed from that workflow.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.RemoveFromWorkflow
member.summary: Removes the page from its Current Workflow.

remarks.para: No action is taken if the page is not in workflow.
If the page is in a Locked workflow, an error is thrown.
If page is checked in, it is unassigned from any group and user after it is removed from workflow.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Republish(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Publishes the page, with or without its descendants, to the specified Publishing Target.
member.param: Publishing target to publish to; this value is required.
Publish the page itself or with its descendants
Incremental or full publish

remarks.para: If pubTarget is null, an error is thrown.
If the current user doesn't have the permissions to perform publishes, an error is thrown.
If the current user doesn't have access to the given publishing target, an error is thrown.
If the publish is incremental and current user doesn't have permission to perform incremental publishes, an error is thrown.
If the page is under the given publishing target, no action is taken.
For incremental publishes, only the pages that were updated since the last publish will be published.
Before the publish task is submitted, the event BeforePublish is fired. The event AfterPublish is fired when the publish task finishes.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Unassign(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the assignment of this page so that it doesn't belong to any User or Group.
member.param: Comments on the unassign action

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.RemoveChildren
member.summary: Removes all children of this page. If the page is not in the Recycle Folder, the child pages will be moved there. Otherwise, they are permenantly deleted.

remarks.para: If the child page is not provided or that page is not child of this page, returns false.
The current user must have the permission to Delete pages. Otherwise, an error is thrown.
The current user must have Full Access to this page. Otherwise, an error is thrown.
If the page is not assigned to the current user and the current user doesn't have to right to assign other users' pages, error will be thrown.
Two events are fired by this method: BeforePageDelete and AfterPageDelete, on the direct child pages of this page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Versions(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the version history of this page. The items are returned by version number in descending order.
member.param: Total count of previous versions.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of previous versions.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.VersionsCount
member.summary: Gets the count of all previous versions of this page.
member.returns: Count of all previous versions

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Version(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a Version of this page by version number.
member.param: Version number of the version to retrieve
member.returns: Version with matching version number

remarks.para: If the version number is the version number of current version, or less than or equal to 0, the current (checked-in) version is returned.
If the version number is greater than 0 and no previous version has the matching version number, this method returns null.

member.summary: Reverts the page's content to that of a given Version.
member.param: Version to which to revert

remarks.para: If version is null, the current version, or a checked-out version, no action is taken.
If the version doesn't belong to this page, an error is thrown.

member.returns: Returns true if this page's PCRs are inherited, false otherwise

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SendGroupNotificationMail(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.IWorkflow,Ingeniux.CMS.ITransition)
member.summary: Sends out a Workflow notification email to all Users of a given Group.
member.param: The group to send email to. All users with valid email addresses in this group will receive the email.
The user this page will be assigend to after the given Transition
The comments the user put in during workflow advancement
The workflow this page is currently on
The transition to be used to advance the page in workflow

remarks.para: This method will not send out emails if the SendWorkFlowNotificationMail setting is false.
The subject and body of the workflow notification email are based on a predefined template, located in the App_Data\xml\custom\emailNotifications folder.
The file name of the workflow notification email template is workflowNotifications.xml.
Modify this file to change the email content.
remarks.example:
Workflow notification email template default content. Note that the names between two percent characters ("%")are variables; these are case-sensitive. %siteName% - %workflowName% Notification - %pageName% - %pageId%

Workflow Notification

%workingUserName% advanced the item %pageName% (%pageId%) through the "%transitionName%" transition in the "%workflowName%" workflow, and assigned it to %nextUserName%

Comments from Assigning User:
%comments%

View Item:
%siteUrl%?ID=%pageId%

member.param: The workflow this page is currently on

The email addresses of the recipients, delimited by semicolons.
The comments user put in during workflow advancement

The file name of the workflow notification email template is workflowNotifications.xml.

Workflow Notification

%workingUserName% advanced the item %pageName% (%pageId%) through the "%transitionName%" transition in the "%workflowName%" workflow, and assigned it to %nextUserName%

Comments from Assigning User:
%comments%

View Item:
%siteUrl%?ID=%pageId%

member.summary: Gets the hierarchy value of the page in the content tree.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.StartDate
member.summary: Gets and sets the start date of the page. When set, this page will not be included in navigations when current time is less than the StartDate value.
member.remarks: Defaults to null value, which means there is no start date.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.IsComponent
member.summary: Gets whether this page is a component. Components are used as part of other pages, don't have their own URL entries, and don't have specific view or style sheet rendering specified in content.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CheckedOut
member.summary: Gets whether this page is checked out. A page has to be checked out to a specific User to be edited. A page's checked-out content is subject to modification by the assigned User. These modifications can only be published if the page is checked in.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Removed
member.summary: Gets whether the page is under Removed status, which means it is currently a descendant of the Recycle Folder.
member.remarks: Removed pages cannot be checked out or marked for publish. A removed page must first be moved out of the Recycle Folder before it can behave like a normal page.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.NowSyncing
member.summary: Gets whether the page is currently being synchronized to the latest version of the Schema used to create it.
member.remarks: When a page is being synchronzied to its schema, it cannot be checked out or saved.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.JustSynced
member.summary: Gets whether the page's content was updated via Schema synchronization and hasn't yet been modified directly.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Icon
member.summary: Gets and sets the icon of the page. The value is the numeric representation of the icon images.
member.remarks: Icon numeric values are subject to change and aren't listed here.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Schema
member.summary: Gets the Schema from which this page is based on.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CreationSchema
member.summary: Gets the Schema from which this page was originally created from. Note that it is normally the same as Schema property value, unless this Page has presentations and created a new Schema with the presentations.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SchemaVersion
member.summary: Gets the Schema Version which with this page is synchronized. Note that if the schema has not been updated and or sychronized to this page, the page will be on a older version of the schema.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AssignedUser
member.summary: Gets the User to whom this page is currently assigned. If the page is not assigned to a user, this method returns null.
member.remarks: A page could be unassigned, assigned to a User or assigned to a Group. Having an assigned user doesn't necessarily mean that the page is checked out to that user.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AssignedGroup
member.summary: Gets the Group to which this page is currently assigned. If the page is not assigned to a group, this method returns null.
member.remarks: A page could be unassigned, assigned to a User, or assigned to a Group. The method can only be called if the page is assigned to a group to which the current user belongs.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Locale
member.summary: Gets and sets the language of this page.

remarks.para: Setting the locale of a page is retricted under several conditions:
The page doesn't inherit its locale from an ancestor page.
The page isn't the ancestor of a page that has its locale specified already.
If the above conditions are not met, calling this method throws an exception.
After the locale is set on a page, all the page's descendants inherit it unless the CanParentRegionRoots property is true.
If CanParentRegionRoots is true, this page will allow regions to to live under it, potentially allowing pages in another language as descendants.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.LocaleInherited
member.summary: Gets whether this page inherits its locale from its ancestor page.
member.remarks: When a page doesn't have a locale set, it inherits its ancestor page's null locale. In that case, this property returns true.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.MasterLingualMap
member.summary: Gets the lingual map between this page and its Master Page.
member.remarks: If this page is not clone of any page, this method returns null.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SerializeOnCheckIn
member.summary: Determines whether to serialize an xID.xml file to the v9 XML root on check-in.

remarks.para: By default, this property is set to false. It should only be used to deal with old XSLT sites that have legacy "document" calls in XSLT style sheets.
It is recommended to remove these calls from XSLT stylesheets since missing these files could cause the rendering of Page to be completely broken.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.Site
member.summary: Gets the Site object that owns the current page. This Site object was the object in charge of retrieving or creating the current Page object.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.SecurityInherited
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this page inherits security information from its parent page.

remarks.para: By default, all pages inherit security information from the Content Store node x1.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.AssignmentComment
member.summary: Gets the comments from assignments when the page was not in workflow.

remarks.para: This method returns the last comment from the last manual assignment on the page when it wasn't in workflow. It is not necessarily the last comment when page was assigned.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CurrentWorkflow
member.summary: Gets the workflow this page is in. If page is not in a workflow, this method returns null.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.LastVersion
member.summary: Gets the most-recent previous version. It is the version before this page was last checked in.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.RulesInherited
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this page inherits the page creation rule (PCR) settings from its parent page or has its own page creation settings.

remarks.para: By default, when a page is just created, this value of this property is true.
When the first PCR is set to this page, the value becomes false.
Changing this value from false to true, removes all PCR information from this page.
Do not set the property to false directly. Instead to SetPageCreationRule method to set a PCR.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.PCRDescriptorID
member.summary: Gets the ID of a page creation rule (PCR) descriptor. PCR Descriptors are used to mark pages that have specific PCR settings.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.ReferenceMapping
member.summary: Retrieves the directly referenced page IDs for this page. This mappings are reference pages added to this page.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPage.CanParentRegionRoots
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this page allows region roots (pages with a noninherited locale) when the page isn't language-neutral.

remarks.para: If this page doesn't have any locale information, the value of this property is alway true, and setting this property will not do anything
If this page has locale information, then without the value being true, all of its children must inherit the locale this page has.

member.summary: The base interface for all manager objects. It manages one or more types of object collections in the content store. Transactional entities are exclusive to the sessions that initiated them, and cannot be used across sessions.

member.summary: Creates a temporary Write Session to quickly write something outside the current Session and transaction. This is a way to bypass the transaction and quickly put something into the content store.
member.param: Callback that performs the write action
member.remarks: Do not use this method if transactional saving is intended.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITransactionalEntity.DeepClone``2(``0)
member.summary: Duplicates an object instance, not including its unique ID.
member.param: Original object to clone from
member.returns: The cloned object.

remarks.para: Deep-cloning an object retains all of the original object's property values except the unique ID, creation user, creation time, last-modified user, and last-modified time.
The cloned object is re-augmented with all the session information.
Cloning a null object or an object from another session throws an error.

member.exception: When the cloneFrom object is null
When the cloneFrom object was retrieved from a different session.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUrlMap.Rebuild(System.String,System.Boolean,Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rebuilds the complete collection of URL maps and outputs the resulting XML file to a specific location.
member.param: The full path of the Folder in which to place the generated URL map XML file
Determines the name of the URL map XML file. When true, the file name is just "urlmap.xml"; when false, the file name is this entity's unique ID plus ".xml".
The structured URL settings. These typically comes from the Publishing Target that this collection belongs to. Exposed as parameter so it can be customized.
The User that will perform the rebuild

remarks.para: The generated URL maps file will be placed in the App_Data/pub/[pub target folder]/settings folder.

member.example:
Generated urlmap.xml example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Site HomePageID="x2" ForceLowerCaseURL="false" AutoRedirectCanonicalURL="true" EnabledExtensions="" URLExtension="" UseStructuredURL="true"> <Page ID="x11" Path="/Champlain" Schema="CaseStudy" /> <Page ID="x12" Path="/Mica" Schema="CaseStudy" /> <Page ID="x13" Path="/Midwestern" Schema="CaseStudy" /> <Page ID="x14" Path="/Company/News" Schema="NewsandEventsFront" /> <Page ID="x15" Path="/Company/News/News-Archive" Schema="NewsArchive" /> <Page ID="x17" Path="/Company/News/News-Archive/Ingeniux-Announces-Dates-for-2014-User-Conference" Schema="NewsDetail" /> <Page ID="x2" Path="/" Schema="Home" /> <Page ID="x28" Path="/Company" Schema="SectionDetail" /> <Page ID="x34" Path="/Products" Schema="ProductFront" /> <Page ID="x35" Path="/Products/Cartella-x35" Schema="ProductDetail"> <Renamed Path="/Products/Cartella" Canonical="true" /> </Page> <Page ID="x41" Path="/Solutions" Schema="SolutionsFront" /> <Page ID="x43" Path="/Products/Cartella-x43" Schema="ProductDetail" /> <Page ID="x44" Path="/Products/CMS" Schema="ProductDetail" /> <Page ID="x47" Path="/Solutions/Mainstream" Schema="SolutionsDetail" /> </Site>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUrlMap.Rebuild(System.String,System.Boolean,Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rebuilds the complete collection of URL maps and outputs the XML file to a specific location, with an explicitly specified list of marked Pages.
member.param: The full path of the Folder in which to place the generated URL map XML file
Determines the name of the URL map XML file. When true, the file name is just "urlmap.xml"; when false, the file name is this entity's unique ID plus ".xml"
The structured URL settings. These typically come from the Publishing Target that this collection belongs to. Exposed as parameter so it can be customized.
The User that will perform the rebuild
Dictionary of marked Pages for the given Publishing Target. The keys of the dictionary are xIDs; the values are marked version numbers.

remarks.para: The generated URL maps file will be placed in the App_Data/pub/[pub target folder]/settings folder.

member.example:
Generated urlmap.xml example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Site HomePageID="x2" ForceLowerCaseURL="false" AutoRedirectCanonicalURL="true" EnabledExtensions="" URLExtension="" UseStructuredURL="true"> <Page ID="x11" Path="/Champlain" Schema="CaseStudy" /> <Page ID="x12" Path="/Mica" Schema="CaseStudy" /> <Page ID="x13" Path="/Midwestern" Schema="CaseStudy" /> <Page ID="x14" Path="/Company/News" Schema="NewsandEventsFront" /> <Page ID="x15" Path="/Company/News/News-Archive" Schema="NewsArchive" /> <Page ID="x17" Path="/Company/News/News-Archive/Ingeniux-Announces-Dates-for-2014-User-Conference" Schema="NewsDetail" /> <Page ID="x2" Path="/" Schema="Home" /> <Page ID="x28" Path="/Company" Schema="SectionDetail" /> <Page ID="x34" Path="/Products" Schema="ProductFront" /> <Page ID="x35" Path="/Products/Cartella-x35" Schema="ProductDetail"> <Renamed Path="/Products/Cartella" Canonical="true" /> </Page> <Page ID="x41" Path="/Solutions" Schema="SolutionsFront" /> <Page ID="x43" Path="/Products/Cartella-x43" Schema="ProductDetail" /> <Page ID="x44" Path="/Products/CMS" Schema="ProductDetail" /> <Page ID="x47" Path="/Solutions/Mainstream" Schema="SolutionsDetail" /> </Site>

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager
member.summary:
Represents the manager object that provides the means to query and manage the following publishing- and runtime-related objects:
Publishing Targets, Publishing Profiles, Structured Url Maps, Runtime Redirects, Replication System, Publishing Tasks and Replication Tasks.
It also provides ways to manage InSite Search configuration of CMS published content.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object, and it only works within that session.

member.example:
The Publishing Manager can serialize two output XML documents: Publishing Targets and Publishing Profiles.
Publishing Target serialization resembles the the publishingtargets.xml file before CMS 9.0:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <PublishingTargets> <PublishingTarget ID="PublishingTargets/1" Name="Production" PublishFolder="production" RootPageID="x2" UserAgentSearchString="" SiteSearchString="" Transform="false" ReplicationTarget="" ReplicationTargetModule="" LastPublishDate="20140314T23:49:39" UseStructuredURL="true" HomePageID="x11" NotFoundID="x722" URLExtension="" URLSeparator="-" ForceLowerCaseURL="true" AutoRedirectCanonicalURL="true" IncludeFoldersInURL="false" NormalizeURLSeparators="true" BaseURL="http://services1.ingeniux.com/centraulv75rt/" UseExternalPreviewURL="true" DynamicPublishing="true" ExternalPreviewURL="/cms80/DssPreview/IGXDynamicPreview" ICEFieldMarkupUpdateURL="/cms80/DssPreview/IGXDTICEUpdate" GlobalContentRoot=""> <Replication DoReplication="false" SimultaneousReplication="false"/> <Page ID="x2" Version="0"/> <Page ID="x11" Version="2"/> <Page ID="x37" Version="0"/> </PublishingTarget> <PublishingTarget ID="PublishingTargets/3" Name="Staging" PublishFolder="stagin" RootPageID="x2" Transform="false" UserAgentSearchString="" SiteSearchString="" UseStructuredURL="true" HomePageID="x11" NotFoundID="x7" URLExtension="" URLSeparator="-" ForceLowerCaseURL="true" AutoRedirectCanonicalURL="true" IncludeFoldersInURL="true" NormalizeURLSeparators="false" BaseURL="" DynamicPublishing="true" UseExternalPreviewURL="true" ExternalPreviewURL="/cms80/DssPreview/IGXDynamicPreview" ICEFieldMarkupUpdateURL="/cms80/DssPreview/IGXDTICEUpdate" GlobalContentRoot=""> <Replication DoReplication="false" SimultaneousReplication="false"/> </PublishingTarget> </PublishingTargets>

member.summary: Retrieves a URL Maps Collection by its unique ID.

The unique ID of the URL maps collection. It is always tied to the Publishing Target it belongs to.
URL map unique ID example: "UrlMap_PublishingTargets_1" is the ID of URL map for the publishing target "PublishingTargets/1".
member.returns: URL maps collection with matching ID. Returns null if this collection doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager.Task(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a Publishing Task by its unique ID.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager.CreateTask(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingPageEntry},System.Boolean,Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget,System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingPageEntry}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new publishing task and pushes this task into publishing queue. Tasks in the queue are executed in sequence and purged after being executed.
member.param: Collection of pages to be published

Incremental or full publish. Incremental publishes only add or update pages and components that have been added or changed. Full publishes publish all marked pages and components; delete pages and components that are no longer marked; and clean up assets at the publishing target location.
The target to publish pages to
The action to call after filter out the Pages that don't need to be published
Whether or not to perform replication after the publish completes. Default is to perform replication.
member.returns: The created and queue publishing task
member.exception: During an incremental publish, when there are no pages or components that have been added or updated since the most-recent publish.

remarks.para: Publish Tasks are centered around pages and components, not assets, for incremental publishes.
If no pages or components changed since last publish, it doesn't matter whether any assets are changed. The publish will not occur.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager.RemoveTask(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTask)
member.summary: Removes a pending Publishing Task.
member.param: The Publishing Task to remove
member.returns: True if task is removed, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If task parameter value is null, returns false.
It is possible to remove a Publishing Task that is being executed, but it will not stop execution.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager.SerializeRedirects(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget)
member.summary: Produces XML serialization of the Redirect entries that apply to the given Publishing Target. The Dynamic Site Server depends on the results of this serialization to control redirects.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager.PublishingTargetsSerialize
member.summary: Produces the XML serialization of the Publishing Targets collection. The result matches the XML format of publishingTargets.xml prior to CMS 9.0.
member.returns: XML serialization of publishing targets their publish markings.
member.example:
Example of publishing targets serialization:
<PublishingTargets > <PublishingTarget ID="PublishingTargets/12" Name="Production" PublishFolder="production" RootPageID="x2" UserAgentSearchString="" SiteSearchString="" Transform="false" ReplicationTarget="" ReplicationTargetModule="" LastPublishDate="20140324T23:11:00" UseStructuredURL="true" HomePageID="x11" NotFoundID="x722" URLExtension="" URLSeparator="-" ForceLowerCaseURL="true" AutoRedirectCanonicalURL="true" IncludeFoldersInURL="false" NormalizeURLSeparators="true" BaseURL="" UseExternalPreviewURL="false"> <Page ID="x2" Version="6"/> <Page ID="x11" Version="2"/> <Page ID="x37" Version="3"/> <Page ID="x201" Version="0"/> </PublishingTarget> </PublishingTargets>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingManager.PublishingProfilesSerialize
member.summary: Produces the XML serialization of the Publishing Profiles collection. The result matches the XML format of PublishingProfiles.xml prior to CMS 9.0.
member.returns: XML serialization of publishing profiles and the publishing targets they include.
member.example:
Example of publishing profiles serialization:
<PublishingProfiles > <PubProfile ID="PublishingProfile/43" Name="Production for All Languages"> <BlockedAccess> <Group ID="UserGroups/125" /> </BlockedAccess> <PubTarget ID="PublishingTargets/1" /> <PubTarget ID="PublishingTargets/6" /> </PubProfile> </PublishingProfiles>

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings
member.summary: Represents the settings of a structured URL for a specific Publishing Target.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.UseStructuredUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the structured URL is enabled for the Publishing Target.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.HomePage
member.summary: Gets/sets the ID of the published site's home page. This Page will be the root of a published site. All its descendants will obtain their structured URL based on their relative path from the Home Page.

remarks.para: If the UseStructuredUrl property is true, this property is required. Publishing will generate an error if it is null or empty.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.UrlExtension
member.summary: Gets/sets the extension of the URL to access pages at a run-time site. Can be left empty to have an extensionless URL.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.UrlSeparator
member.summary: Gets/sets the character used to replace spaces in Page names for the generated page URLs.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.Handle404Page
member.summary: Gets/sets the ID of the 404 response handling Page. If not specified, the Dynamic Site Server uses the ASP.NET default 404 handling page to indicate missing resources.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.BaseUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets the base URL of the runtime site to which this Publishing Target publishes. It should always be an absolute URL.
member.example: http:///www.yourfirm.com/stagin/

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.ForceLowerCaseUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets whether to convert to lowercase for generated URL characters. This setting is effective during publish.
member.remarks: This property on matters for non-DSS integrations of runtime sites. Standard IIS sites are case insensitive.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.StripDiacritics
member.summary: Gets/sets whether to remove diacritics and accents from extended characters in the Western European/Latin-1/Windows-1251 character set in the URL.
member.example: "Å¡" will be converted to "s"
member.remarks: Please note that any single-byte characters beyond Western European/Latin-1/Windows-1251 will not be converted and all multiple-byte characters (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, etc.) will not be converted.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.AutoRedirectCanonical
member.summary: Gets/sets whether pages with multiple URL mappings automatically redirect from a noncanonical to a canonical URL. If true, redirects will happen automatically. Otherwise, users visit the page's noncanonical URL (normally from the page's past names or paths due to renaming the page or moving it in the site tree) and no redirect occurs.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.IncludeFoldersInUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets whether to include names of the ancestors that are folders in a page's URL. If true, names of folders will be included. If false, they won't be.

remarks.para: Including folders in the URL is neither right nor wrong; it's simply a matter of preference.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.IncludeComponentsInUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets whether to include names of the ancestors that are components in a page's URL. If true, names of comonents will be included. If false, they won't be.

remarks.para: As with the property, including components in the URL is neither right nor wrong; it's simply a matter of preference.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.NormalizeUrlSeparators
member.summary: Gets/sets whether to change all of the "-" and "-" to the value of the UrlSeparator property.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.EnabledExtensions
member.summary: Gets/sets extra extensions to support besides the specified UrlExtension. Normally, .xml, .htm, and .html are automatically supported if this setting is left null or empty. If the setting is not null or empty, this property's values are explicited followed.

remarks.para: The list of extensions can start with or without ".".

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IStructuredUrlSettings.LastModified
member.summary: Last time the SURL settings were modified. For use when building url map.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.StructuredUrlSettings.UseStructuredUrl
member.summary: True if using structured URLs

member.summary: True if all Structured URLs to be made lower case
