member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget
member.summary: Represents the location to which a list of marked Pages is published as well as the settings on how the published contents get replicated. Also provides information on how the Dynamic Site Server hosts the published content in a runtime environment.
member.example:
Serialization of a publishing target is very similar to the publishingtargets.xml file's PublishingTarget element before CMS 9.0:
<PublishingTarget ID="PublishingTargets/1" Name="Production" PublishFolder="production" RootPageID="x2" UserAgentSearchString="" SiteSearchString="" Transform="false" ReplicationTarget="" ReplicationTargetModule="" LastPublishDate="20140314T23:49:39" UseStructuredURL="true" HomePageID="x11" NotFoundID="x722" URLExtension="" URLSeparator="-" ForceLowerCaseURL="true" AutoRedirectCanonicalURL="true" IncludeFoldersInURL="false" NormalizeURLSeparators="true" BaseURL="http://services1.ingeniux.com/centraulv75rt/" UseExternalPreviewURL="true" DynamicPublishing="true" ExternalPreviewURL="/cms80/DssPreview/IGXDynamicPreview" ICEFieldMarkupUpdateURL="/cms80/DssPreview/IGXDTICEUpdate" GlobalContentRoot=""> <Replication DoReplication="false" SimultaneousReplication="false"/> <Page ID="x2" Version="0"/> <Page ID="x11" Version="2"/> <Page ID="x37" Version="0"/> </PublishingTarget>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.UrlMap
member.summary: Retrieves the URL Map for this publishing target.
member.returns: URL map for this publishing target

remarks.para: When a publishing target is not published yet, the URL map will be empty. The very first full publish populates the URL map for all pages marked for publish on that publishing target.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.Replicator
member.summary: Retrieves the Replicator object, which is in charge of performing replication tasks.
member.returns: The Replicator object for this publishing target.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.Publish(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Performs a publish on this publishing target, including all Pages marked on this target as candidates to be published.

For a non-Transform-on-publish target, this action creates XML files for pages and components marked for this target; generates all metadata files needed for the Dynamic Site Server; and copies all updated assets.
For a Transform-on-publish target, Pages will be fully expanded and XSLT transformed, then saved to target folder in a structural format. Updated assets are also copied.

member.param: Whether to only publish changed Pages or all pages. Default is incremental.
Whether to perform replication after a successful publish. Default is to replicate.

remarks.para: This method is in charge of handling the task that performs the actual publishes. It does not wait for the publish to finish.
All publish tasks are pushed into a queue and executed in sequence.

Incremental publishes will detect if any pages were changed (checked in, marked for publish changes, etc.), since the last publish. If no pages have changed since the last publish, an error is thrown.
A full publish first cleans up the target folder by deleting all files and directories.
If the current user doesn't have access to this publishing target, a publish doesn't happen and an error log entry is written to the design-time log.
All XSLT style sheets in the "xml/Stylesheets" folder are validated during publish.
The event BeforePublish is fired prior to creating a Publishing Task.
The event BeforePublish is fired after a Publishing Task completes the actual publish, not after the Publishing Task is created.

member.exception: When this Publishing Target is retrieved via a Read-only Session.

When current user doesn't have the permission to perform a publish; when the current user can't access this publishing target; or when performing an incremental publish and the current user doesn't have permision to incrementally publish.
When any XSLT style sheet failed to load as an XML document.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.RepublishPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Performs publish on a Page, or the page and its descendants, towards this publishing target.

For a non-Transform-on-publish target, this action creates XML files for pages and components marked for this target; generates all metadata files needed for the Dynamic Site Server; and copies over all updated assets.
For a Transform-on-publish target, Pages will be fully expanded and XSLT transformed, then saved to target folder in a structured format. Updated assets are also copied over.

member.param: The root Page to be published
Whether to only publish the Page itself, or with with its descendants.
Whether to only publish changed Pages or all pages. Default is incremental.
Whether to perform replication after a successful publish. Default is to replicate.

remarks.para: This method is in charge of handling the task that carries out the actual publishes. It will not wait for the publish to finish.
All publish tasks are pushed into a queue and executed in sequence.
Incremental publishes will detect if any pages were changed (checked in, marked for publish changes, etc.) since the last publish. If no pages are changed since the last publish, an error is thrown.
Full publishes first clean up the target folder by deleting all files and directories.
If current user doesn't have access right to use this publishing target, the publish will not happen and an error log entry will be written to design-time log.
All XSLT style sheets in the "xml/Stylesheets" folder are validated during publish.
The event BeforePublish is fired prior to creating a Publishing Task.
The event BeforePublish is fired after a Publishing Task completes the actual publish, not after the Publishing Task is created.

member.exception: When this Publishing Target is retrieved via a Read-only Session.

When current user doesn't have the permission to perform a publish; when the current user can't access this publishing target; or when performing an incremental publish and the current user doesn't have permision to incrementally publish.
When any XSLT style sheet failed to load as an XML document.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.PublishPages(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IPage},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Performs publishes on multiple root Pages, or together with their descendants, toward this publishing target.

For a non-Transform-on-publish target, this action creates XML files for pages and components marked for publishing on this target; generates all metadata files needed for the Dynamic Site Server; and copies over all updated assets.
For a Transform-on-publish target, Pages are fully expanded and XSLT transformed, then saved to target folder in a structured format. Updated assets are also copied over.

member.param: The root Pages to be published
Whether to publish only the Pages themselves, or together with their descendants.
Whether to publish only changed Pages or all pages. Default is incremental.
Whether to perform replication after a successful publish. Default is to replicate.

remarks.para: This method is in charge of handling the task that carries out the actual publishes. It will not wait for the publish to finish.
All publish tasks are pushed into a queue and executed in sequence.
Incremental publishes will detect if any pages were changed (checked in, marked for publish changes, etc.), since the last publish. If no pages are changed since the last publish, an error is thrown.
Full publishes first clean up the target folder by deleting all files and directories.
If the current user doesn't have access right to use this publishing target, a publish will not happen and an error log entry will be written to design-time log.
All XSLT style sheets in the "xml/Stylesheets" folder are validated during publish.
The event BeforePublish is fired prior to creating a Publishing Task.
The event BeforePublish is fired after a Publishing Task completes the actual publish, not after the Publishing Task is created.

member.exception: When this Publishing Target is retrieved via a Read-only Session.

When current user doesn't have the permission to perform a publish; when the current user can't access this publishing target; or when performing an incremental publish and the current user doesn't have permision to incrementally publish.
When any XSLT style sheet failed to load as an XML document.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.CanMarkPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Checks whether a Page can be marked on this publishing target.
member.param: Page to check on
member.returns: True if the Page can be marked, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If the Page is a component, it can be marked for publish on any publishing target.
If not, it must be the a descendant of the Root Page of this publishing target to be marked for publish.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkedOnPageCurrentVersion(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified Page is marked for publish on its current checked-in version.
member.param: The page to check marking on
member.returns: True if latest version of the specified Page is marked on this publishing target.

remarks.para: If the specified Page is not marked on this publishing target, but on previous version, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkedOnPageVersion(Ingeniux.CMS.IPageVersion)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified Page is marked on its specific Version.
member.param: The page's version on which to check marked-for-publish status
member.returns: True if the version number of the specified PageVersion is marked on this publishing target.

remarks.para: If the specified Page is marked on this publishing target, but not the specified version number, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkPageForPublish(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks or unmarks a Page to publish, on a specified version number, on this publishing target.
member.param: The page whose publish marking to change
Whether to mark or unmark the Page
If to mark for publish, the version number to mark on. Default value is 0, means marking the Page on its latest version.

remarks.para: Recycled Pages cannot be marked for publish.
The specified Page's Last Modified Time will be updated after calling this method.
The events BeforePublishingTargetMarkForPublishChange and AfterPublishingTargetMarkForPublishChange are fired before and after, respectively, calling this method.

member.exception: When the "page" parameter value is null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkedPages(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of Page Versions that are marked on this publishing target.
member.param: Total count of entries
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of marked page versions

remarks.para: Empty collection is returned when no pages are marked on this publishing target.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.Marked(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified Page is marked on this publishing target.
member.param: The Page to check marking on
member.returns: True if any version of this Page (excluding the checked-out version) is marked for publish on this publishing target.

remarks.para: If the "page" parameter value is null, returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.Marked(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the Page specified is marked on this publishing target.
member.param: The ID of the Page to check marking on
member.returns: True if any version of this Page (excluding the checked-out version) is marked for publish on this publishing target.

remarks.para: If the page ID is null or empty, returns false

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkedVersionForPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Retrieves the marked Version of the specified Page on this publishing target.
member.param: Page to check marking on
member.returns: The marked Version for the specified Page on this publishing target.

remarks.para: This method returns null if the "page" parameter value is null, or if the Page is not marked for publish on this Publishing Targer.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkedVersionForPage(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the marked version number of the Page with a specified ID.
member.param: ID of the Page to check marking on
member.returns: The marked version of the given Page. If the page is not marked on this publishing target, returns -1.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.MarkedPagesCount
member.summary: Gets the count of Pages marked on this Publishing Target on any version.
member.returns: Count of Pages that were marked on this Publishing Target.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.PendingPublishes
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of pending Publishing Tasks issued by this Publishing Target.
member.returns: Collection of pending Publishing Tasks from this Publishing Target.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.RelativePublishFolder
member.summary: Gets/sets the name of the folder to which content is published. It is located under the pub folder.

remarks.para: Note that, as of CMS 9.0, the pub folder is no longer a child of the xml folder, but rather its sibling. Both are children of the App_Data folder.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.PublishFolder
member.summary: Gets/sets the full physical path of the folder to which content is published.
member.exception: When sets to a null or an empty value, or the value of path is not under the pub folder.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.RootPage
member.summary: Gets/sets the root Page for this target. Pages (not components) must be under this root page in order to be marked for publish. Only marked-for-publish pages under this page will be published.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.GlobalContentRoot
member.summary: Get and sets the root Location that contains all the components that also needs to be published. This setting is only effective when the global content root is not under the Root Page.

remarks.para: Unlike pages, components can be marked for any Publishing Target. Only marked components under this page or the Root Page are published.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.Transform
member.summary: Gets/sets whether to fully expand the Pages and apply XSLT style sheets during publishing. Set this property to true for publishing to nonâ€“Dynamic Site Server content locations.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.UserAgentSearchString
member.summary: Gets/sets the search string for the User Agent. This setting only applies when the Transform property is true, transforms on publishes behave very similarly to a browser request on a page at runtime.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.SiteSearchString
member.summary: Gets/sets the search string for site branding. This setting only applies when theTransform property is true, since transforms on publishes behave very similarly to a browser request on a page at runtime.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.PublishingSystemSecurity
member.summary: Gets/sets the security settings for this publishing target.
member.exception: When setting a null value to this property

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.SURLSettings
member.summary: Gets/sets the structured URL settings for this publishing target.
member.exception: When setting null value to this property

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.ExcludedFiles
member.summary: Gets/sets the asset files that will be excluded during publish.

remarks.para: When setting a null value to this property, the excluded files list is emptied.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.ExcludedDirectories
member.summary: Gets/sets the asset directories that will be excluded during publish. Any files in these directories will not be copied to the target location.

remarks.para: When setting a null value to this property, the excluded directories list is emptied.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.LastPublishDate
member.summary: Gets the time when this publishing target last performed a publish. The property returns null if this publishing target never published.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.UseExternalPreviewUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the Publishing Target uses an external preview URL.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.ExternalPreviewUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets the URL for previewing Pages with this Publishing Target on the Ingeniux CMS user interface.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.IceFieldMarkupUpdateUrl
member.summary: Gets/sets the URL for providing markup feedback upon updating a Page's Element value, via In-Context Editing or Page Builder.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.Profile
member.summary: Gets/sets the Publishing Profile to which this Publishing Target belongs.

remarks.para: If this Publishing Target doesn't belong to any Publishing Profile, this property returns null.
If this property is set to a null value, then it will not belong to any Publishing Profile.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.EnableDynamicPublishing
member.summary: Gets/sets whether Dynamic Publishing is enabled for this Publishing Target.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget.PresentationFormatter
member.summary: Gets/sets the full class name of the formatter for presentations formatting on this Publishing Target.

remarks.para: If not explicitly set, or set to null or empty, this property returns the value in the settings at the "Presentations/Formatter" section.

member.summary: Gets/sets whether to exclude lingual maps, during publishing and preview

Serialization:
<PublishTask PubDoneFileName="publishdone.txt" SyncDoneFilename="synchdone.lck"> <Settings> <IsFullPublish>true</IsFullPublish> <PublishingTarget ID="PublishingTargets/23" Name="Production" /> <RootPage>x3</RootPage> <Submitted UTC="true">20140618T19:21:14</Submitted> <SubmitUser UserID="ingeniux\\admin1" IPAddress="10.10.2.254" ServerId="5B9D6571-F894-45EF-AD83-D930CEF3E89D" /> </Settings> <Pages Count="3"> <Page ID="x45" Version="9" TransformOnPublish="false" /> <Page ID="x789" Version="2" TransformOnPublish="false" /> <Page ID="x6" Version="13" TransformOnPublish="false" /> </Pages> </PublishTask>

member.summary: Moves the hierarchy to be under another ancestor
member.param: Old ancestor node
New ancestor node

param.name: copyMode
param.para: Specifies if the ancestor moving is due to a copy action of the node object that is taking this hierarchy.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IHierarchyId.Next
member.summary: Retrieves the next sibling hierarchy available.
member.returns: The next sibling hierarchy, it is the same parent hierarchy, the last digit is the rounded last digit of this hierarchy plus 1
member.remarks: This method is used when adding a new sibling to a tree node and finding out what hierarchy should be assigned to the new node.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IHierarchyId.NextChild

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IUser.IntegratedMembershipProvider
member.summary: Gets and sets the full name of the Type of the provider object that authenticates this user.

remarks.para: A User being an integrated membership provider means the CSAPI can create, update, and remove this user account directly via the specified Type.
When the value of this property is null or empty, the user is not an integrated user.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IUser.ReadLocales
member.summary: Gets and sets the Languages this user can read.

remarks.para: A user can only access the Translation interface if the user's Read Locales include the Locale of the master Page's Locale and its Write Locales include the clone Page's Locale.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IUser.WriteLocales
member.summary: Gets and sets the Languages this user can write.

remarks.para: A user can only access the Translation interface if the user's Read Locales include the locale of the mster Page's Locale and its Write Locales include the clone Page's Locale.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IUser.ReceiveWorkFlowNotificationMail
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this user will receive notification emails after a Page advances through is Workflow.

remarks.para: During Workflow Advance, the CMS tries to send emails to the page's Assigned User, and the User the Page will be assigned to. The value of this property sets whether those users receive their notification emails or not.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IUser.UserRights

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserManager.AddUser(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new User.
member.param: The ID of the User
Name of the User
The Email address of the User
member.returns: The User that was created.

remarks.para: The new User that was created was not yet saved to the Content Store. It will be saved when the Write Session is disposed.
The new User cannot yet login to the CMS until it is added to at least one Group.
If "name" parameter value is null or empty, the "userId" parameter value will be used for the User Name.
The event UserCreated is fired after the new User is created in Session.

member.exception: When "userId" is null or empty.
When another User with the same User Id already exists.
When the Operating User doesn't have administrative privileges.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserManager.RemoveUser(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Permanently removes a User.
member.param: The User to remove
member.returns: True if the User still exists in Content Store, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If the "user" parameter value is null, returns false.
The method also removes this User from all Groups it belonged to.
This method fires two events: BeforeUserDelete and AfterUserDelete.

member.exception: When the "user" is the Current Operating User.
When the Operating User doesn't have administrative privileges.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserManager.User(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a User by its User ID or Entity ID.
member.param: User ID or Entity ID of the User to retrieve
member.returns: The User with matching User ID or Entity ID, null if the user doens't exist.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserManager.AddUserGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new User Group.
member.param: Name of the new Group to create
member.returns: The User Group that was created.

remarks.para: The new User Group that was created was not yet saved to the Content Store. It will be saved when the Write Session is disposed.
The new User Group doesn't have any member Users associated with it.
The event UserGroupCreated is fired after the new UserGroup is created in Session.

member.exception: When "name" is null or empty.
When the Operating User doesn't have administrative privileges.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserManager.RemoveUserGroup(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Removes a User Group from the Content Store.
member.param: The User Group to remove
member.returns: True if "userGroup" is not null and exists, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If the "userGroup" parameter value is null, returns false.
The Administrators Group cannot be removed.
This method fires two events: BeforeUserGroupDelete and AfterUserGroupDelete.

member.exception: When the "userGroup" is the Administrators Group, which cannot be removed
When the Operating User doesn't have administrative privileges.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession
member.summary: Represents a communication session used to retrieve objects from the content store. It is also the place to get all manager instances.

remarks.para: Objects retrieved within the session are only usable before the session is disposed. Their methods do not work outside the created session, and their properties are not guaranteed to work outside of the created session.
UserSessions are created from a persisting ContentStore object via the method . The best way to open a UserSession, and to make sure it is closed properly, is with a "using" statement:
Objects retrieved via UserSession are read-only. An error is thrown upon closing the session if any of the objects were updated.
If the objects are intended to be changed, use the UserWriteSession object.

member.exception: When any objects retrieved within a read-only UserSession are modified.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession.CompositeGet``2(System.String,``1,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}}[])
member.summary: Retrieves an entity with given ID and objects related to the entity. The includeExpression defines what to include.
member.remarks: The purpose of this method is to load objects that are returns on properties for given entity. Therefore, when calling the properties of an entity, no additional calls to the content store are required. Callbacks with too many additional objects will slow loading time for the specified entity.
member.typeparam: Type of the entity to retrieve. The entity must be a non-abstract type that implements the interface.
The entity's manager type, which must implement .
member.param: Unique ID of the entity to retrieve.
The manager that retrieves the entity.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession.List``1
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of all objects of a given type.
member.remarks: The actual execution of a query is deferred; therefore, additional queries can apply to the result and be executed on the content-store side. In order for the query to be executed on content-store side, additional queries cannot use any of the object's methods, only fields and direct properties. If content storeâ€“side execution is not required, you should first convert the result to an array using the "ToArray()" method.
member.returns: Collection of objects of given type. Deferred execution.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession.CompositeList``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}}[])
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of all objects of a given type as well as all objects related to the object type. The includeExpression defines what to include.
member.typeparam: Type of the objects to retrieve
member.param: The callbacks to determine what additional objects are retrieved together
member.returns: Collection of objects with a given type. At the same time, included objects are retireved to reduce content-store calls. Deferred execution.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession.Query``2

summary.para: Queries the content store and returns a collection of objects of a given type. The query is based on the type of index provided.

THe CSAPI creates indexes in the content store to expedite object lookup. CSAPI comes with a set of indexes for its basic functionality. All strong-typed queries go through this method. Additional custom indexes can be created to provide even further flexibilities on fast lookup. Please refer to the topic for more information on indexes and custom indexes.

member.returns: Collection of objects with a given type. Deferred execution.

remarks.para: By default, the query returns all objects indexed with a given index type.

Because the execution of query is deferred, additional queries can be applied to the result and executed on content-store side. In order for the query to be executed on content-store side, additional queries cannot use any of the object's methods, only fields and direct properties. If content storeâ€“side execution is not required, you should first convert the result to an array using the "ToArray()" method.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession.LuceneQuery``2(System.String)

summary.para: Queries the content store using Lucene query syntax and returns a collection of objects of given type.

The CSAPI creates indexes in the content store to expedite object lookup. The CSAPI comes with a set of indexes for its basic functionality. All strong-typed queries go through this method. Additional custom indexes can be created to provide further flexibility on fast lookup. Please refer to the topic for more information on indexes and custom indexes.

member.param: The Lucene query
member.returns: Collection of objects of the given type. Deferred execution.

remarks.para: Because the execution of the query is deferred, additional queries can be applied to the result and be executed on content-store side. For the query to be executed on content-store side, additional queries cannot use any of the object's methods, only fields and direct properties. If content store sideâ€“execution is not required, you should first convet the result to an array using the "ToArray()" method.

example.para: Lucene query syntax is fairly straightforward. Use the indexable property names and check if they contain the value.
For example, searching by name for a page that starts with the word "test" would look something like this:
For more information on Lucene indexing, refer to .

member.summary: Gets the time that this session was opened.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserSession.ContentFreezeStartingTime
member.summary: Gets the time when content freeze is about to start. Null if no content freeze looming.

member.name: F:Ingeniux.CMS.UserSession._RavenDbSessions
member.summary:
UserSession maintain a list of raven sessions. Since each raven session only has up to 30 actions allowed, We need to make sure before it reaches its limit, we will create another raven session and use that for upcoming actions until that run out of actions too.
But we want to save 1 empty action per session for final saving.
With this system, we can load a lot of entities in one user session and update them together in one shot.

member.name: F:Ingeniux.CMS.UserSession._LoadedObjects
member.summary:
Raven session do cache loaded objects to make sure they are not being loaded again. We will put all of them in this dictionary too Since it is reference based, it will not take too much memory.
The nice thing about it is we can always reuse the same object that has been loaded, thus greatly reduce database traffic

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.UserSession.Save
member.summary: Save changes for Objects in session
member.remarks: This can be called in the middle of the session to save the objects. It will not close the sessions

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserWriteSession
member.summary: Represents a communication session used not only to retrieve objects from the content store, but also to create, delete, and modify objects. It is also the place to get all manager instances.

remarks.para: Objects retrieved within the session are only usable until the session is disposed. That means their methods don't work outside the session, their properties are not guaranteed to work outside the session.
UserSession objects are created from a persisting ContentStore object via the method . The best way to open and close a UserSession is with a "using" statement:

Objects retrieved via UserWriteSession are automatically tracked for their changes. The changes are saved to the content store when the sesison is disposed. However, you can always manually perform saves via method at any time.
If the objects are intended to be changed, use the UserWriteSession object.

member.param: The object to add.
member.exception: When the parameter is null
member.remarks: When the parameter "obj" is null value, an error will be thrown.

member.param: The object to be deleted
member.remarks: When the parameter value is null, nothing happens. Any objects with IDs that do not exist in the content store are ignored.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IAction

summary.para: Represents a task to be completed when a transition is executed. An action is associated with a transition through the method.

There are actions for common operations in the content tree, such as checking in a page and marking a page for publish. If the built-in actions are not adequate, developers can create custom workflow actions. Custom workflow actions assemblies must be put in App_Data/xml/custom/plugins/CustomWorkflowActions directory. The actual Action class must implement the interface. The custom action uses its full class name as the value of the ProgID attribute and calls the Execute method to perform the action.

The actions associated with a transition are executed in the order in which they are added to the transition. If an action fails to execute, the transition will not complete. The workflow remains in the WorkState it was in before the transition executed.

member.example:
Serialization of the Action object matches the Action elements in the WorkflowDefinitions.xml file in the last-generation CMS:
<Action ID="action_3" Description="Republish site" Type="Republish" PubTarget="PublishingTargets/2"/>
The difference is that the system no longer stores names of entities as identifiers. For example, the PubTarget attribute of Republish action is now storing the PubTarget ID instead of the name.

summary.para: Represents a path between two Work States. When a Workflow advances from one workstate to another, it goes through a transition.
Transitions allow for ownership change of a page in workflow. Transitions can also can execute built-in or custom Actions.
Transitions are defined in Workflow Definitions and carried out in Workflow Instances.

example.para: Serialization of a transition instance matches the transition entries in the workflowdefinitions.xml file in previous-generation CMS content:
example.code: <Transition CurrentStateID="WorkStates/1" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/4" NextStateID="WorkStates/4" Trigger="OnCreate"> <Actions NextID="4"> <Action ID="action_1" Type="MarkForPublish"/> <Action ID="action_2" Type="CheckIn"/> <Action ID="action_3" Type="Republish"/> </Actions> </Transition>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITransition.AddAction(Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumActionType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new Action to the transition, at the end of the list.
member.param: The type of Action to add
Description of the Action; default is empty
member.returns: The newly created action.

remarks.para: Differnt types of actions have different sets of required attributes. Because this method doesn't add those attributes, they need to be added later.

member.summary: Removes an Action from a transition.
member.param: The Action to remove
member.returns: True if action exists in the transition, false otherwise.

member.param: The order of new action IDs

member.summary: Gets and sets the default User to whom to assign the Page in Workflow when the transition advances to the next workstate. The transition doesn't automatically assign the Page to this User; It is only a recommendation from the transition on whom should be assigned the Page.

remarks.para: This property cannot be set before is set to an existing Group.
This user must be a member of .
The Ingeniux CMS client uses the default user information to automatically select a user to assign the page in the UI.

member.exception: When the property value is null, or when doesn't include the provided user.

member.summary: Gets and sets the next Group to which page assignments are restricted when the transition advances to the next workstate. The must be a member of this group.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IWorkflow
member.summary: Represents the an instance of a Workflow Definition associated with a single Page. Once a Page is added to a Workflow, a new instance of the Workflow object is created and attached to the Page. This allows precise control of the Page's lifecycle. It's also a good way to track the history of actions that occur on the Page.

example.para: Serialization of a Workflow instance matches an entry in the Workflows.xml from previous-generation CMS content:
example.code: <WorkFlow Comment="Existing page added to workflow" CurrentStateID="WorkStates/2" TransitionID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" CurrentGroupID="UserGroups/2" WorkFlowDefinitionID="WorkflowDefintions/4" PageID="x1551" Name="News Approval Workflow"/>
example.para: Please note that the "Name" attribute value is changed from generic "Page WF (x1551)" to the name of the Workflow Definition.

The comments to store on this assignment action
member.remarks: The assigned user must be a member of .

member.summary: Returns the collection of Log entries on this workflow. These logs entries record the history of Workflow Transitions.

member.remarks: If a workflow is removed (page is removed from workflow), the log entries will not be removed. This leaves a history of a workflow that no longer exists, but it does provide the history of the page as it goes in and out of workflows.

member.summary: Advances this workflow from its current Work State to the next Work State, using a specified Transition. Meanwhile, determines which User to whom to assign the workflow, and whether to perform Actions.
member.param: The transition that is used to advance the workflow, the next Work State of this workflow will be the on the transition.
User comments on the advancement
The user to whom to assign the page. If default, assign to the of the transition, or the on the transition if DefaultUser is not specified.
Specifies whether to perform the actions on the transition. Defaults to true.
Specifies whether to assign page to next group if no user is provided. If false it will choose the default user if possible before resorting to group. Defaults to false.

member.exception: When workflow is locked

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IWorkflowManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that provides the means to query and manage Workflow Definitions, Work States, and Workflow Log entry collections.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object and only work within that session.

example.para: Serialization of the Workflow Manager matches the serialization of workflowdefinitions.xml in previous-generation CMS content:
example.code: <WorkFlowDefs> <WorkStates> <WorkState ID="WorkStates/1" Name="Initial"/> <WorkState ID="WorkStates/2" Name="Incomplete"/> <WorkState ID="WorkStates/3" Name="Complete"/> </WorkStates> <WorkFlowDefinitions> <WorkFlowDefinition Description="Used to track News Articles submitted through the website's entry form." ID="WorkflowDefintions/1" Name="Anonymous News Submission"> <Transitions> <Transition AllowNextGroupToAdvance="false" CurrentStateID="WorkStates/1" DefaultUserID="" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/1_1" IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/3" NextStateID="WorkStates/2" ToolbarIcon="" Trigger="OnCreate"> <Actions NextID="1"/> </Transition> <Transition CurrentStateID="WorkStates/2" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/4" NextStateID="WorkStates/3" Trigger="OnCreate"> <Actions NextID="4"> <Action ID="action_1" Type="MarkForPublish"/> <Action ID="action_2" Type="CheckIn"/> <Action ID="action_3" Type="Republish"/> </Actions> </Transition> </Transitions> </WorkFlowDefinition> </WorkFlowDefinitions> </WorkFlowDefs>

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IWorkflowDefinition
member.summary: Represents a definition of workflow. Defines a Transitions tree/loop to move Pages through, the Users to assign page to, and the Actions to perform on these transitions.

remarks.para: Note the conceptual difference between a Workflow Definition and a workflow:
A Workflow Definition is the host of all the transition information.

A workflow is based on a workflow defintion and is specific to one Page, but it only holds the information on the current state, the most recent transition, and user comments on the most recent transition.

example.para: Serialization of a workflow defintion matches a definition entry in the workflowdefinitions.xml file in previous-generation CMS site content:
example.code: <WorkFlowDefinition Description="Used to track News Articles submitted through the website's entry form." ID="WorkflowDefintions/1" Name="Anonymous News Submission"> <Transitions> <Transition AllowNextGroupToAdvance="false" CurrentStateID="WorkStates/1" DefaultUserID="" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/1_1" IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/3" NextStateID="WorkStates/2" ToolbarIcon="" Trigger="OnCreate"> <Actions NextID="1"/> </Transition> <Transition CurrentStateID="WorkStates/2" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/4" NextStateID="WorkStates/3" Trigger="OnCreate"> <Actions NextID="4"> <Action ID="action_1" Type="MarkForPublish"/> <Action ID="action_2" Type="CheckIn"/> <Action ID="action_3" Type="Republish"/> </Actions> </Transition> </Transitions> </WorkFlowDefinition>

summary.para: Represents the Global Variable entry. As the name indicates, global variables are placeholders that hold specific values They can be used in any part of an element value or attribute. The purpose of this object is to allow static information that is repeated across multiple pages or fields to be editable in only one place.

Global variables always have a global value, which applies to all publishing targets. They may also contain override values for specific publishing targets. During publish, these override values are used for the publishing targets to which the global variables belong.
Global variables are defined in the CMS and undergo value replacement in the DSS.

example.para:
Global variables are retrieved via the Global Variables Collection manager object.
IGlobalVariable copyRightVar = session.GlobalVariables.Variable("CopyRight");

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IGlobalVariable.Value(System.String)

member.param: ID of the publishing target
member.returns: Publishing target override value or global value.

Publishing targets that will use this override value.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale
member.summary: Represents a standard ISO locale definition. The concept of locale is a combination of language and region. A more common term to describe a locale is "culture."

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.FormatNumber(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the value of the number provided to its equivalent string representation using the culture-specific format information.
member.param: The number to be formatted
Specified if to return currentcy format of the number. Note that the currency symbol is specific to the region specified in this locale.
member.returns: Formatted string of given number
member.example: If the locale is "en-us", the number 1234.56 is formatted as "1,234.56", but under "it-it", it's formatted as "1.234,56", the European format.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.FormatTimeLong(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a time value to its equivalent string representation using culture-specific long-format information.
member.param: Value of DateTime in milliseconds
Specifies whether to only include date information.
member.returns: Formatted long string of given time.

example.para: Milliseconds: 63512604517280
en-us: Tuesday, August 20, 2013 2:08:37 PM
en-us date only: Tuesday, August 20, 2013
fr-ca date only: 20 aoÃ»t 2013

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.FormatTimeShort(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a time value to its equivalent string representation using culture-specific short format information.
member.param: Value of DateTime in milliseconds
Specifies whether to include only date information.
member.returns: Formatted short string of given time

example.para: Milliseconds: 63512604603336
en-us date only: 8/20/2013
fr-ca date only: 2013-08-20

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.LCID
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the locale's underlying culture.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.RegionCode
member.summary: Gets the locale's region code. It is the same as the property.
member.example: For the locale of "English, United States", the RegionCode is "en-us".

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the locale. The name is the same as the of the locale.
member.example: For the locale of "English, United States", the Name value is "en-us".

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.NativeName
member.summary: Gets the culture name. This consists of the full name of the language, the full name of the country/region, and the optional script. This name is written in the locale's native language.
member.remarks: For all locales a language value of "English", the native name and the are the same.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.EnglishName
member.summary: Gets the culture name in the format "<languagefull> (<country/regionfull>)" in English, where <languagefull> is the full name of the language and <country/regionfull> is the full name of the country/region.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.ISOLanguageName
member.summary: Gets the ISO 639-2 three-letter code for the locale's language.
member.example: For the locale "en-us", the ISOLanguageName is "eng".
member.remarks: ISOLanguageName only describes the language property of a locale; it doesn't include any regional information.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale.WindowsLanguageName
member.summary: Gets the three-letter code for the language as defined in the Windows API.
member.example: For the locale "en-us", the ISOLanguageName is "ENU".

remarks.para: In most cases, this name only represents a locale's language property. Sometimes, however, the concept of language is very specific to a region, and it's difficult to separate the two. That's why the WindowsLanguageName of "en-us" is "ENU", which still contains the United States' regional information.
WindowsLanguageName may differ depending on the generation of Windows operating system being used.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ICustomLocale
member.summary: Represents a custom locale. It is used to extend the list of ISO locales and to allow more choices of languages in the WorldView system.
member.remarks: A custom locale must be based on an existing ISO locale; it cannot be based on another custom locale.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ICustomLocale.BaseName

member.summary: Adds a new custom locale or updates an existing custom locale with new values.
member.param: Base standard ISO locale
Region code/name of the custom locale
Description of the custom locale
member.returns: The created or updated custom locale.

remarks.para: If the region code already exists in the custom locale's collection, that custom locale will be updated with new information.
the custom locale has to be based on a standard ISO locale. It can never be based on another custom locale.
If the region code provided exists as standard ISO locale region code, the system throws an error.

member.exception: When base locale is a custom locale, or when region code is an existing standard ISO locale region code.

summary.para: Represents a field in schema. It corresponds to an element or attribute in a page.
A schema contains a flat list of multiple fields.

remarks.para: Normally one schema field corresponds to one page field. However there are exceptions:
A Group element in the schema consists of two fields: GroupStart and GroupEnd.
A List element may have multiple child elements, but in the schema, the List element and its children's properties are defined in one field.

member.returns: True if entry with a matching name exists, false otherwise.

summary.para: Represents the Manager object that provides functionalities to manage translations of Schemas, Page Creation Rules, Workflow Defintions and States, into various languages for display on the user interfaces of Ingeniux CMS client.
The translated Schemas will replace the original field label and help text on Edit Form of a Page.
The translated Page Creation Rules will override the Page Creation Rule selection dialog's rule names.
The translated Workflow Definitions and Work States will change the labels of Workflow advancement dialogs.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule

summary.para: Defines the criteria for creating a new Page, including Schema, location, and limitations on Groups and Users.
Page creation rules provide a controlled way to create pages; their main purpose is to enforce restrictions on page creation for nonadministrative users.
Because they provide ways to limit page creation locations, they can also be a used as shortcuts for creating pages quickly.
In addition, page creation rules can add newly created pages directly into workflows.

remarks.para: Page creation rule instances are managed by PageCreationRulesManager.

member.example:
Example of serialization output:
<PageCreationRule Name="Create an Event" ID="PageCreationRules/232" Icon="16" IsDefault="false" Schema="Event Detail" StyleSheetFileName="default.xsl" wfid=""> <Users> <User ID="ingeniux\admin1"/> <User ID="ingeniux\author2"/> </Users> <Groups> <Group ID="UserGroups/234"/> <Group ID="UserGroups/42"/> <Group ID="UserGroups/1"/> </Groups> </PageCreationRule>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.ClearUsersAndGroups
member.summary: Removes all users and groups that are allowed to use this page creation rule to create pages. This renders the page creation rule unusable.

remarks.para: This method makes the page creation rule unusable, but an administrator can still edit it.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.Users
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of explicitly defined Users that can use this page creation rule to create Pages.
member.returns: Collection of users that are explicitly definied as being able to use this page creation rule; returns empty collection if there are no users explicitly defined to use the rule.

remarks.para: This method returns the collection of users that are explicitly defined. It is not necessarily all the users that can use this page creation rule.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.AddUser(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Adds a new User to the list of users explicitly allowed to use this page creation rule.
member.param: User to add to the list

remarks.para: This method does nothing if the user parameter is null or the User is already on the list of allowed users.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.RemoveUser(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Removes a User from the list of users explicitly allowed to use this page creation rule.
member.param: User to remove from the list
member.returns: True if this user is not null and currently on the list of allowed users. Otherwise, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.UsersCount
member.summary: Gets the count of explicitly allowed Users.
member.returns: Count of explicitly allowed users

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.Groups
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of Groups that are allowed to use this page creation rule to create Pages.
member.returns: Collection of Groupsthat are allowed to use this page creation rule to create pages.

remarks.para: The Users in the allowed groups, and the Users on the explicitly defined users list, together make up the collection of users that can use this page creation rule.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.AddGroup(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Adds a new Group to the allowed groups that can use this page creation rule.
member.param: The group to add to the list

remarks.para: This method does nothing if the group parameter is null or this Group is already on the list of allowed groups.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.RemoveGroup(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Removes a Group from the list of group explicitly allowed to use this page creation rule.
member.param: Group to remove from the allowed list
member.returns: True if this group is not null and is currently in the list of allowed groups. Otherwise, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.GroupsCount
member.summary: Gets the count of allowed Groups.
member.returns: Count of allowed Groups

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.FirstAccessibleParentPage
member.summary: Retrieves the first parent Page under which this page creation rule can be used to create pages and to which the current User has Full Access.
member.returns: The first accessible page under which this page creation rule can create pages.

remarks.para: A page creation rule can be assigned to multiple parent Pages. Each parent page could also allow all its descendants to be available to this page creation rule.
This means, when using a page creation rule, a root page must be selected first.
This method is useful when a page creation rule need only create a page and the page's location doesn't matter.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.ParentPages
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of parent Pages under which the page creation rule is allowed to create pages.
member.returns: Collection of parent pages with the information on whether their descendants are included. Empty collection is returned if no parent pages exist.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.SetParentPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a Page as parent page of this page creation rule.
member.param: Parent page to set
Determines whether to include descendants

remarks.para: If the page parameter value is null, this method does nothing
A page creation rule may have multiple parent pages. This method adds the specified page as parent page. If the page was already a parent page, this method updates the existing entry.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.RemoveParentPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Removes a parent Page from the parent pages collection
member.param: Page to remove from parent pages collection
member.returns: True if the given page is not null and was in the parent page collection. Otherwise, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.ParentPagesCount
member.summary: Gets the count of parent page entries for this page creation rule.
member.returns: Count of parent pages

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.UnassociateWorkflowDefinition
member.summary: Removes the Workflow Definition from this page creation rule.

remarks.para: This method doesnothing if no workflow definition is associated with this page creation rule.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.AllowPageCreation(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified User is allowed to use this page creation rulee to create Pages.
member.param: User to check
member.returns: True if user is not null and is either member of any allowed Groups, or on the list of explicitly allowed Users. Otherwise, this method returns false.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.Schema
member.summary: Gets and sets the Schema that used to create Pages.

remarks.para: When this property is null, an error is thrown.
This schema cannot be deleted as long as a page creation rule based on it still exists.

member.exception: When assigning null to this property

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.StyleSheet
member.summary: Gets and sets the overriding XSLT style sheet for this page creation rule.

remarks.para: This property's value is the file name of the XSLT style sheet, located in the App_Date/xml/stylesheets folder
By default, page creation uses the XSLT style sheet set on the schema. The value of this property is the value of the StyleSheet property on the schema.
If this property is set and the override value is not null or empty, then the new page created uses the style sheet defined here.
If the value to set on the property doesn't end in ".xsl" or ".xslt", an error is thrown.
If the file specified in the value to set on the property doesn't exist, an error is thrown.

member.exception: When the value to set on the property doesn't end with ".xsl" or ".xslt"
When the file specified in the value to set on the property doesn't exist

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this page creation rule is the default rule when more than one PCR is allowed for a given Group.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.WorkFlowDefinition
member.summary: Gets and sets the Workflow Definition to which this page creation rule is connected. Pages created via this page creation rule are automatically added to the specified Workflow.

remarks.para: Do not directly set the WorkflowDefinition to null, as this causes an error to be thrown.
Use the UnassociateWorkflowDefinition method instead.

member.exception: When trying to assign null to this property.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule.AutoSelectParent
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this page creation rule allows the currently selected Page to be used as a parent page for page creation. This property doesn't serve any purpose on the API level. It provides a suggestive value in the user interface layer.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRulesManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that provides the means to query and manage Page Creation Rules.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object and only work within that session.

example.para: Serialization of the Page Creation Rules Manager matches the serialization of pagecreationrules.xml in previous-generation CMS content:
example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16" standalone="no"?> <PageCreationRules NextID="10"> <PageCreationRule Name="Create an Image" ID="6" Icon="PageCreationRules/211" IsDefault="false" Schema="Image" StyleSheetFileName="" wfid=""> <Users/> <Groups> <Group ID="UserGroups/54"/> <Group ID="UserGroups/1"/> </Groups> </PageCreationRule> <PageCreationRule Name="Create an Event" ID="PageCreationRules/232" Icon="16" IsDefault="false" Schema="Event Detail" StyleSheetFileName="default.xsl" wfid=""> <Users> <User ID="ingeniux\admin1"/> <User ID="ingeniux\author2"/> </Users> <Groups> <Group ID="UserGroups/234"/> <Group ID="UserGroups/42"/> <Group ID="UserGroups/1"/> </Groups> </PageCreationRule> </PageCreationRules>

Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Colletion of all page creation rules

The schema on which to filter
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of page creation rules based on the specified schema

remarks.para: If the schema parameter is null, returns all page creation rules

The user that can use the page creation rules
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.

member.summary: Gets the count of all Page Creation Rules

summary.para: Represents the manager object that provides the means to query and manage Pages and Page Versions.
It is the most important manager, due to fact it manages the central pieces of CMS, the Pages.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object and only work within that session.
Unlike the Site object before version 9.0, DO NOT store instance of this object in ASP.NET session.

example.para: Serialization of Site matches the serialization of reference.xml in previous-generation CMS content:

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.MetaDataRead``1(System.Func{Ingeniux.CMS.IContentStoreMetaData,``0})
member.summary: Retrieves a meta data value via callback
member.typeparam: Type of the value to return. Result will be casted to this value.
member.param: The method to call to get the actual metadata value.
member.returns: Value of Site instance metadata

remarks.para: If the meta data not yet exists in meta data collection, it will be created on the fly with empty value.

example.para: To retrieve the Server Name of this Site Instance

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.ContentFreezeState
member.summary: Retrieves the Content Freeze State of the Site Instance. This object is used to toggle content freeze on the Site Instance.
member.returns: The Content Freeze State object

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.FreezeContent(System.DateTime,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IUser},System.String)
member.summary: Plans a Content Freeze on the Site Instance.
member.param: Time to start the Content Freeze, this value can be before "Now" time, which means Content Freeze will start right away.
The ending time of the Content Freeze. If null value, Content Freeze state will have to be terminated by calling CancelContentFreeze method.

The list of Users that can still work with CMS during Content Freeze, besides the User that calls this method. If null or empty collection, only the calling User can work with CMS during Content Freeze.
The message to display to blocked Users during Content Freeze.
member.exception: When a User without administrative permission trying to start a new Content Freeze, or when a User not in the allowed Users list, trying to change a pending or ongoing Content Freeze.
When endTime is greater than startTime.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.CancelContentFreeze
member.summary: Cancel a pending or ongoing Content Freeze State.

remarks.para: Any administrator can cancel a Content Freeze, only the original initiator and allowed Users can update a Content Freeze.

member.exception: When a User without administrative permission calling this method.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.PagesCount
member.summary: Gets the count of Pages on this Site Instance.
member.returns: Count of all Pages.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.SiteRoot
member.summary: Retrieves the Root Page of the Site Instance.
member.returns: Root Page of the Site Instance.

remarks.para: Root Page is automatically created during Site Creation.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.Page(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a Page by its unique Id.
member.param: Id of the Page to retrieve, alway starts with letter "x" and ends with numbers. e.g. x1234
member.returns: Page with matching Id, or null when no Page with matching Id found.

remarks.para: Prior to V9.0, retrieving a Page with invalid id with cause exception to be throw. This is changed in V9.0 to just return a null value.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.Pages(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of Pages by their unique Ids.
member.param: Ids of the Pages to retrieve
member.returns: Pages with matching Ids

remarks.para: The collection will not contain any null values. All non-existing Ids are ignored.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.Pages(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of all Pages, in a paginated fashion.
member.param: Outputs total count of entries
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of Pages

remarks.para: Pages are returned in the order they were created. This doesn't necessarily mean it will always start with smallest XID, especially for content migrated from Version 8.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.Components(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)

Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of Component Pages

remarks.para: Pages are returned in the order they were created. This doesn't necessarily mean it will always start with smallest XID, especially for content migrated from Version 8.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.PagesByKeywords(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of Pages by keywords in the Pages' Name, and any text/xhtml field values, in a paginated fashion.
member.param: The keyword to search for
Count of total entries
Whether to use checked out Version of the Page for Pages that are checked out
Whether to include Removed Pages in the collection.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of Pages that contains the searching keyword in its Name or any text/xhtml fields.

remarks.para: The method call pulls results from a Full-Text index created on the Content Store. Due to the full text nature of the index, you will immediately have the results, but it may not always 100% up-to-date on the latest changes.

Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.

member.returns: Collection of Pages that contains the searching keyword in its Name or any text/xhtml fields.

remarks.para: The method call pulls results from a Full-Text index created on the Content Store. Due to the full text nature of the index, you will immediately have the results, but it may not always 100% up-to-date on the latest changes.

Whether to include Pages that are assigned to the Groups the User belongs to

member.summary: Retrieves the XSLT stylesheets collection in the "App_Data\xml\Stylesheets" Folder.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.ValidateStylesheets
member.summary: Perform XML validation on the XSLT stylesheets.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.RemovePage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage@)
member.summary: Removes a single Page.
member.param: The page to remove/purge
member.returns: True if Page exists, false otherwise.

remarks.para: if "page" is null, returns false.
If the Page is not under Recycle Folder, it will be moved to Recycle Folder. If it is already under Recycle Folder, it will be permenantly purged.
Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageDelete and AfterPageDelete.

member.exception: When trrying to remove Site Root or Recycle Folder; or trying to remove a Page assigned to another User, but doesn't have the right to Assign other's Pages.
When Operating User doesn't have the right to Delete Pages, or doens't have full access to the Page to be removed.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.CopyPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumCopyActions)
member.summary: Copies a Page together with its descendants, to the specified location.
member.param: The Page to be copied
The target reference location Page. The copied Page could be placed before, after, or as child of this Page.
The location to place the copied Pages relative to the "targetParentPage"
member.returns: The copied Pages

remarks.para: Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageCopy and AfterPageCopy.

member.exception: When the parameter "srcPage" or "tgtParentPage" is null, or "tgtParentPage" being Root of the Site, and the "placing" is to a sibling position.
When "srcPage" or "tgtParentPage" doesn't have valid Hierarchy value.
When "srcPagg" is either Root Page or Recycle Folder.
When Operating User doesn't have the necessary node-level permssions. The Operating User must have at least read-only permission on "srcPage", and full access on the actual target parent Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.MovePage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumCopyActions)
member.summary: Moves a Page together with its descendants, to the specified location.
member.param: The Page to be moved
The target reference location Page. The moved Page could be placed before, after, or as child of this Page.
The location to place the moved Pages relative to the "targetParentPage"
member.returns: The "srcPage" after it has been moved.

remarks.para: Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforePageMove and AfterPageMove.

member.exception: When "srcPage" or "tgtParentPage" doesn't have valid Hierarchy value.
When "srcPage" is either Root Page or Recycle Folder.
When Operating User doesn't have the necessary node-level permssions. The Operating User must have full access to both "srcPage" and the actual target parent Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.CreatePage(Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema,System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Page with specific Schema.
member.param: The schema to have the new Page based on
Name of the new Page
The parent Page to create the new Page under
Whether to place the Page before or after the existing child Pages
Whether to create a Dummy Page or not. Dummy Pages are temporary, therefore, parameters "parentPage" and "insertAtBeginning" don't matter
member.returns: The created new Page

remarks.para: When "isDummy" is true, the created Page is temporary. It will not be saved to Content Store. Therefore, no security validations will apply. Anybody can create a dummy Page.
If "parentPage" parameter value is null, the new Page will be created under the Site Root.
If "pageName" is null or empty, it will be default to one empty space.
"schema" must be specified, or error will be thrown.
The "schema" cannot be in draft mode, when "isDummy" is false, or error will be thrown.
If "parentPage" is the Recycle Folder, error will be thrown.
The event "PageCreated" will be fired upon page creation, if "isDummy" is false.

member.exception: When the "schema" parameter is null
When "isDummy" is false, and either "parentPage" is Recycle Folder, or "schema" is in Draft mode.
When "isDummy" is false, and either Operating User doesn't have the right to Create Pages, or doesn't have full access to the "parentPage".

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.CreatePage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPageCreationRule,System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Page based on a Page Creation Rule.
member.param: The Page Creation Rule to use to create the new Page
Name of the new Page
The Parent Page to create the new Page under. It must be in the list of allowed Parent Pages of the "pcr"
Whether to add the created Page to Workflow, if the "pcr" has Workflow Definition tie-in already. If not, this parameter has no impact
The "Id" of the User to assign the created Page to, if the "dontAddToWorkFlow" parameter is true
member.returns: The created new Page

remarks.para: "pcr" parameter cannot be null, or error will be thrown.
If "pageName" is null or empty, it will be default to one empty space.

When "overrideParentPage" is not null, it must be allowed for the "pcr" as a Parent Page to create new Pages under; When it is null, the "pcr"'s First accessible Parent Page will be used as parent Page.
The parameter "userId" doesn't have to be specified. If not specified, the new Page will be assigned to either the Default Transition 's Default User, to the Transitions's Next Group.
The event "PageCreated" will be fired upon page creation.

member.exception: When "pcr" parameter is null
When "pcr" doesn't have any Parent Pages and "overrideParentPage" is null, or "overrideParentPage" is not in the allow Parent Pages for the "pcr".
When Operating User doesn't have full access to the actual parent Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.RecycleFolder
member.summary: Retrieves the Recycle Folder of the Site Instance
member.returns: The Recycle Folder page.

remarks.para: Recycle Folder cannot be Removed.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.EmptyRecycleFolder
member.summary: Permenantly delete all Pages under Recycle Folder.

remarks.para: Two events are fired during execution of this method: BeforeEmptyRecycleFolder and AfterEmptyRecycleFolder.

member.exception: When Operating User doesn't have the right to Delete Pages.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.CrossLocaleCopyPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumCopyActions,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Copies a Page with language settings, together with its descendants, to another location of a Page with language settings, when there is a Lingual Map established between the Region Roots of both Pages .
This method will create a collection of Lingual Maps from the source Page and its descendants, to their corresponding clone Pages.

member.param: The Page to be copied
The target location
The location to place the copied Pages relative to the "parent"

Whether to ignore any existing Lingual Map of the source Page that was already mapped to to the "parent"'s Locale. If true, system will remove the existing map silently before creating a new one. If not, a error will be thrown.
member.returns: The new Lingual Map between the source Page and its copied Page at target location

remarks.para: This method is for strictly copying Pages between lingual sections that already have their Region Roots mapped. Failure to meet this condition will generate errors.
When "ignoreExistingMaps" is true, system to silently remove any Lingual Map that source Page has at target Locale.
When "ignoreExistingMaps" is false, error will be thrown.
Four events are fired in the following order: BeforeCrossLocaleCopy, BeforePageCopy, AfterPageCopy, and AfterCrossLocaleCopy.

member.exception: When the parameter "page" or "parentPage" is null, or "parentPage" being Root of the Site, and the "placing" is to a sibling position.
When "page" or "parentPage" doesn't have valid Hierarchy value.
When "page" is either Root Page or Recycle Folder; Or when the Region Roots of "page" and "parentPage" don't have established Lingual Map yet.
When Operating User doesn't have the necessary node-level permssions. The Operating User must have at least read-only permission on "page", and full access on the actual target parent Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.CopyRegionRootPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumCopyActions,Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale)

summary.para: Clones a Region Root, together with its descendants, to another location. The cloned Page will also be a Region Root, with the specified language setting applied.
This method will create a collection of Lingual Maps from the source Page and its descendants, to their corresponding clone Pages.

member.param: The Region Root Page to be copied
The target location
The location to place the copied Pages relative to the "parent"
The language to set on the cloned Region Root
member.returns: The new Lingual Map between the source Region Root and its clone Region Root at target location

remarks.para: This method for for strictly copying a Page that is a Region Root. That means this Page must have a Locale, and must not Inheriting the Locale from its ancestor. Failure to meet this condition will generate errors.
Four events are fired in the following order: BeforeRegionRootCopy, BeforePageCopy, AfterPageCopy, and AfterRegionRootCopy.

member.exception: When the parameter "page" or "parentPage" is null, or "parentPage" being Root of the Site, and the "placing" is to a sibling position, or when "targetLocale" is null.
When "page" or "parentPage" doesn't have valid Hierarchy value, or when "page" is not Region Root,
When "page" is either Root Page or Recycle Folder; Or when the Region Roots of "page" and "parentPage" don't have established Lingual Map yet.
When Operating User doesn't have the necessary node-level permssions. The Operating User must have at least read-only permission on "page", and full access on the actual target parent Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.RegionRoots(System.Int32@,Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the Pages that have Locales set and not Inheriting Locale from their ancestors, in a paginated fashion.
member.param: Count of total entries
The Locale to filter the collection.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Pages that are Region Roots, and/or matches the filter Locale

remarks.para: There could be multiple Region Roots in a Site Instance, and multiple Region Roots with the same language. They could have Lingual Maps between, or have no relation with each other.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.SerializeForPublishing(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget)
member.summary: Produces XML serialization for a specific Publishing Target. This method generates the content of published reference.xml for Dynamic Site Server.
member.param: The Publishing Target to serializ for
member.returns: Xml content generate for the specific Publishing Target

remarks.para: The generate content is the standard reference.xml content, with SiteBaseUrl attribute value set from the Publishing Target's Base Url setting value.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.SerializeForIncrementalPublishing(Ingeniux.CMS.IPublishingTarget,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Incrementally produces XML serialization for a specific Publishing Target. This method generates the content of published reference.xml for Dynamic Site Server.
member.param: The Publishing Target to serialize for
The dictionary of page ids and version numbers to update
member.returns: Xml content generate for the specific Publishing Target

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISite.GetEmailTemplate(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the email template for a specific User.
member.param: The User to retrieve email template for. This determines which language the form of the email template to bring back
The xml file name of the template, name with extension only
member.returns: The email template as XML document, in the language that the User can read or write

remarks.para: All email templates are stored at "App_Data/xml/custom/emailNotifications" folder, grouped by Locale region codes.
remarks.example: The English version of Workflow Notification Email Template is at "App_Data\xml\Custom\emailNotifications\en-us\workflowNotifications.xml".
remarks.para: The default language to use is alway "en-us". So if the User is null, or the User can read or write in "en-us", the "en-us" version will be returned.

If User cannot read or write in "en-us", but there no languages for what this User can read or write, then "en-us" version is still used. If the "en-us" version of template file doesn't exist, we will assume this is a Workflow Email to use the embedded Workflow Email Template, that is written in English.
