member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityEntry
member.summary: Represents a security permission entry for an asset file or folder. Holds a collection of asset node-level permissions.

remarks.para: Permissions set at the file level always override the permissions of the folder the file is in.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityEntry.Permission(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Retrieves the highest permission for a given UserGroup.
member.param: The group that will receive the permission
member.returns: The highest permission level for the given Group

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityEntry.Permission(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Retrieves the highest permission for a given user. The permission is highest of all groups this User belongs to, including the Everyone group.
member.param: The user for whom to retrieve permissions
member.returns: Highest permission level for the given User

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityEntry.Permissions
member.summary: Gets and sets permissions for this security entry

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityEntry.AssetPath
member.summary: Gets the path of the asset for the security entry.
member.remarks: The path is relative to the XML folder

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityEntry.AssetType
member.summary: Gets the type of asset, either a file or a folder, for this security entry.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that manages asset security entries.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager will be retrieved from an object. The manager object only works within that session object.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager.Permission(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumAssetType,Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: For a specific UserGroup, retrieve the highest permission for a given asset path
member.param: The path of asset whose permission information you want to retrieve. The path must be relative to XML folder and cannot start with a "\" character.
The type of asset in the path
The UserGroup whose permission information you want to retrieve
member.returns: The highest permission for given UserGroup

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager.Permission(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumAssetType,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: For a specific User, retrieve the highest permission for a given asset path. The permission is highest of all groups to which the user belongs, including the Everyone group.
member.param: The path of asset whose permission information you want to achieve. The path must be relative to the XML folder and cannot start with a "\" character.
The type of asset in the path
The User whose permission information you want to retrieve
member.returns: The highest permission for given User

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager.Permissions(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumAssetType,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Retrieves all permission entries for a given asset path
member.param: The path of asset whose permission information you want to retrieve. The path must be relative to the XML folder and cannot start a "\" character.
The type of asset in the path
An output parameter that is true if the permissions returned are inherited from the parent folder
member.returns: Collection of permissions for the given asset path

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager.RenameAsset(System.String,System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumAssetType)
member.summary: Carries out security entry updates when asset path is renamed or moved
member.param: The old asset path
The new asset path
The type of asset in the path
member.remarks: This method should be called when trying to programatically change asset paths. It is not automatically called when performing manual file system changes. However, if an asset path is manually changed, its access security entry will not longer apply. The newly updated asset path instead use inherited security, or full access for the Everyone group.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager.RemovePermission(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumAssetType)
member.summary: Removes all permission entries for given asset path.
member.param: The path of asset whose permissions information you want to remove. This path must be relative to the XML folder and cannot start with a "\" character.
The type of asset in the path
member.returns: True if permission is removed, false if permission is not found
member.remarks: The given asset path uses inherited security, or full access for the Everyone group.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetSecurityManager.SetPermission(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumAssetType,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.IAssetNodeLevelPermission})
member.summary: Sets permission for given asset path.
member.param: The path of asset for which you want to set permissions. This path must be relative to the XML folder and cannot start with a "\" character.
The type of asset in the path
The permissions to set to the security entry for the given path
member.remarks: If the security entry doesn't exist for the given asset type, a new security entry will be created.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IEmailer
member.summary: Represents an SMTP utility that provides email functionality within the CSAPI.
member.remarks: Each Emailer instance corresponds to one SMTP server. If the same SMTP server is used to send all emails, only one instance of Emailer is needed.

Recipient addresses
Email subject
Email body

Recipient addresses

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IFinalizeCloneInfo
member.summary: Represents the information of a page's Lingual Version Map's finalization. This information is only be available when the lingual version map is finalized.
member.remarks: Finalization of lingual map marked that for a specific version of master page, it has an official corresponding version of clone page. This way we will have a clear history of when certain version of the page was translated, who approved the translation, and what is the translated clone page's version.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IFinalizeCloneInfo.ClonePageVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of the clone version for the finalization.

member.summary: Gets the date and time of finalization.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IFinalizeCloneInfo.FinalizationUser
member.summary: Gets the user ID of the User that performed the finalization

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualMappingManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that is in charge of lingual mapping between pages. Lingual maps are an essential part of the Ingeniux WorldView system

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object. The manager object only works within that session object.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualMappingManager.MapsByMaster(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves collection of lingual maps for given page. In these maps, the provided page serves the role of master page.
member.param: The master page for which to retrieve lingual maps
Outputs total count of entries
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of lingual maps of given page. If page doesn't have any lingual maps, or it is the slave page of a lingual map, returns empty collection.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualMappingManager.MapsByMaster(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves collection of lingual maps for given page. In these maps, the provided page serves the role of master page.
member.param: The master page ID to retrieve lingual maps for
Outputs total count of entries
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of lingual maps of given page. If page doesn't have any lingual maps, or it is the slave page of a lingual map, returns empty collection.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualMappingManager.MapsByMasters(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Represents the lingual relationship mapping for specific version of the master page. This object is an entry in LingualPageMap.

Localization of web pages starts with the source language page (master page). In the beginning, the source language content is finalized and checked in, but there is no translation of this page in the target language. This will be the first entry in lingual map of this master page. It has a version for source page, but doesn't have a version for target page yet. As translation finishes, this lingual version map is finalized. It contains the target language page (clone page) version number. At this point, this version map is closed and kept in history of the master page's translations.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.FinalizeMap(System.Int32,Ingeniux.CMS.IUser)
member.summary: Finalize this lingual version map with clone page version information.
member.param: The version of the translated clone page
The User that performed the finalization. This user may or may not be the current operating user.
member.remarks: This method will close the version map and allow its Page map to create a new version map

member.summary: Gets the owner lingual page map. This object is an entry in the owner's version maps collection

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.MasterPageVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of the master page. This entry is created for this specific master page version.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.InitiationDate
member.summary: Gets the date and time when this entry is created.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.InitiationUser
member.summary: Gets the user ID of the User that created this entry

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.FinalizeInfo
member.summary: Gets the finalization information of this entry. If the translation is not yet finalized, this property is null.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.Finalized
member.summary: Gets if this entry is finalized. It will only returns True if the FinalizeInfo exists.

member.name: E:Ingeniux.CMS.ILingualPageVersionMap.OnFinalize
member.summary: The event that signals when this lingual version map is finalized. It fires when finalization is confirmed, beform it is saved to the .

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IDevice

summary.para: Represents a mobile device-web browser combination with unique UserAgent string. A device entry with this UserAgent string can be uniquely identified by Ingeniux CMS' mobile device detection system.

member.remarks: This object is for mobile device emulation for page previews.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IDevice.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets the User Agent string in this device/browser combination

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle
member.summary: Represents a collection of device-browser combinations that share a manufacturer and screen size. DeviceBundles are for mobile emulation in page preview only. It has a representative Device that provides a single user agent string for the emulation. If a page previews correctly with selected bundle, it means the page will display properly on all the devices this bundle includes.
member.example:
Serialization of this object matches the DeviceBundle element of in the MobileDevices.xml file in previous-generation CMS content.
<DeviceBundle N="iPhone" W="320" H="480" UA="Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 5_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/534.46 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1 Mobile/9B125 Safari/7534.48.3" RDID="12280-18117-17776-18092"> <D>Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 5_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/534.85 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1 Mobile/9B125 Safari/7534.48.3</D> </DeviceBundle>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.Devices
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of devices included in this bundle, in a paginated format.
member.returns: Collection of devices in this bundle.
member.remarks: A bundle must contain at least one device.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.DevicesCount
member.summary: Gets count of all devices in this bundle.
member.returns: Count of devices in collection.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.Clear
member.summary: Clears all devices from this bundle.
member.remarks: Please note that this will not remove the Representative Device from this bundle.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.AddDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new device to this bundle.
member.param: The ID of the device to add. If the device already existed, do nothing.
member.returns: Newly added device, or the existing device with matching ID

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.RemoveDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a device from bundle.
member.param: The device to remove
member.returns: True if device exists in the collection and is not the Representative Device, false if device doesn't exist in the collection.
member.exception: When the device's user agent matches the Representative Device's user agent

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.SetRepresentativeDevice(Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceInfo)
member.summary: Sets representative device of the bundle.
member.param: Device to set as representative
member.remarks: If the device doesn't exist in bundle, throws error.
member.exception: When the device specified doesn't exist in the collection.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.ScreenWidth
member.summary: Gets the simulated screen width for browser. All devices in this bundle have the same width.
member.remarks: Screen sizes specified here may not be the actual pixel sizes of the device screen. They are virtual sizes the mobile browser specifies.
member.example: The iPhone 5's mobile browsers screen dimensions are 320 x 568 px; however, the physical dimensions are 640 x 1136 px.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.ScreenHeight
member.summary: Gets the simulated screen height for browser. All devices in this bundle will have the same height.
member.remarks: Screen sizes specified here may not be the actual pixel sizes of the device screen. They are virtual sizes the mobile browser specifies.
member.example: The iPhone 5's mobile browsers screen dimensions are 320 x 568 px; however, the physical dimensions are 640 x 1136 px.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceBundle.RepresentativeDevice
member.summary: Gets the device that represents this bundle. This device's user agent is used for mobile preview emulation.
member.remarks: This device cannot be removed from the bundle, but it can be set to another device in the bundle.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.DeviceBundle.Devices
member.summary: Return list of device bundled. The listing is concrete and can be repeated enumerated without worrying about performance.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IDeviceInfo
member.summary: Represents detailed information of a device-browser combination. This information is provided by the Ingeniux CMS mobile detection library for administrative user interfaces. It isn't stored in the bundle.
member.remarks: This object is for mobile device emulation for page previews.

example.para: Serialization of this object matches the "D" element of the MobileDevices.xml file in previous-generation CMS content, except the element text is the user agent instead of device ID:
example.code: <D>Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 5_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/534.85 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1 Mobile/9B125 Safari/7534.48.3</D>

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IMobileDeviceManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that contains the collection of Device Bundles. Also, it can retrieve the information of a device from the Ingeniux CMS mobile detection library.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from a object. It only works within that session object.

member.example:
Serialization of this manager object matches the MobileDevices.xml in previous-generation CMS content.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <MobileDevices Enabled="false"> <GenericDevice W="240" H="320" /> <DeviceBundle N="iPhone" W="320" H="480" UA="Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 5_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/534.46 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1 Mobile/9B125 Safari/7534.48.3" RDID="12280-18117-17776-18092"> <D>Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 5_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/534.85 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1 Mobile/9B125 Safari/7534.48.3</D> </DeviceBundle> <DeviceBundle N="iPad" W="768" H="1024" UA="Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; U; CPU OS 4_3_3 like Mac OS X; en-us) AppleWebKit/533.17.9 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0.5 Mobile/8J2 Safari/6531.22.7" RDID="15767-17090-4201-18092"> </DeviceBundle> </MobileDevices>

summary.para: Represents the information of a step/task entry in a background task to be monitored. Steps are the building blocks of the Task Monitor, which is used to monitor the progress of a task.
Steps are normally constructed with full information during construction of a Task Monitor. Its property values cannot be changed.

summary.para: Represents the information of a step/task entry in a background task to be monitored. This step has a collection of substeps.
Substeps need not have a particular order. List steps can advance from one step to any other step.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IListStep.AdvanceStep(Ingeniux.CMS.IStep)
member.summary: Advance to the specified target step. Target step can be in any state, even a completed state. The specified step is the Ongoing Step. Its state is marked as ON_GOING. If the list step itself hasn't started, it will be started. Otherwise, the ongoing step is marked as COMPLETED.
member.param: Step to advance to
member.remarks: The target step can be ongoing or completed, that means we can always revisit steps that were previously visited.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager
member.summary:
Represents the manager object that provides a means to query and manage the Page cross references collection. The references system provides a different way to relate pages Pages in a nonorganized way.
To relate pages in an organized way, the Taxonomy System is recommended solution.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object, and it only works within that session.

member.example:
Serialization of this Manager object closely resembles the ReferencesMapping.xml file in CMS versions before CMS 9.0.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <ReferencesMapping LastUpdatedUser="ingeniux\admin1" LastUpdated="20140714T11:24:50"> <Definitions> <Definition Description="The Reference" FullName="Reference" TagName="R" /> <Definition Description="The source page XID" FullName="SourcePage" TagName="S" /> <Definition Description="The target page XID" FullName="TargetPage" TagName="T" /> <Definition Description="Last Updated Date" FullName="LastUpdatedDate" TagName="LUD" /> <Definition Description="Last Update User" FullName="LastUpdateUser" TagName="LUU" /> </Definitions> <References> <R S="x123" T="x345" LUU="ingeniux\admin2" LUD="20140714T10.24:01" /> <R S="x6789" T="1011" LUU="ingeniux\admin3" LUD="20140714T10.41:43" /> </References> </ReferencesMapping>

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager.AddReference(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Adds a new reference between two Pages.
member.param: The source page of the Reference
The target page of the Reference
member.returns: Count of References the source Page has after the update.

remarks.para: If either the sourcePage or targetPage parameter value is null, returns 0 without doing anything.
The actual references are stored on the Source Page itself. No additional entities are created.
This method will make the Target Page have a crossreference to the Source Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager.Get(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves all References of the specified Page. This method can query recursively on references of referenced pages, with or without crossreferences.
member.param: Page for which to get references
Whether to include crossreferences or only direct references
Depth of recursion. If value is equal to or less than 1, references of references are not returned
member.returns: Collection of references of specified Page.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager.Count
member.summary: Gets the count of all Reference Entries stored on all Pages.
member.returns: Count of Reference Entries.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager.RemoveReferences(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumReferenceRemovalType)
member.summary: Removes References from and/or to the specified Page.
member.param: Page to remove references for
Type of Reference to remove: source, target, or both

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager.RemoveReference(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Removes a Reference between two Pages.
member.param: The source page of the reference
The target page of the reference
member.returns: True if reference exists, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If the sourcePage or targetPage parameter value is null, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReferencesManager.RemoveReference(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.String)
member.summary: Removes a Reference between two Pages.
member.param: The source page of the reference
The ID of the target reference's target page
member.returns: True if reference exists, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If the sourcePage parameter value is null or the targetPageId value is null or empty, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ReferencesManager.AddReference(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Add target page as a reference from source page
member.param: Page to add reference into
Page referenced to from source
member.returns: Number of referenced on source page

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IReplicationTarget
member.summary: Represents a destination location to which published content is replicated as well as corresponding settings for this location.
member.example:
Serialization example:
<ReplicationTarget Disabled="false" ID="FileReplicationTarget/21" Type="IGX.Replication.FileReplicationTarget" Name="dss04" Description="" UseCommands="false" TargetLocation="\\it-webcms04.eastern.ewu.edu\external_dss_content" ChangeDetectionOnContent="false" UseImpersonation="true" TargetLocationAccessUserName="s-webcmsrpl" TargetLocationAccessUserDomain="eastern.ewu.edu" TargetLocationAccessPassword="RDNxA5JhNQV8P481I5yuWCGtP6VLLKY99C8ApDQKF62BdHRp987hsgagrOlWrGEJ"> <PreReplicationCommand Timeout="10"> </PreReplicationCommand> <PostReplicationCommand Timeout="480">E:\igxsites\Sites\external\xml\Custom\media-servers-replication.bat</PostReplicationCommand> <ExemptLocations> <Exempt RelativePath="/PreBuilt/.svn/" ExemptAllFiles="true" ExemptDescendantDirectories="true" SearchPatterns=""/> <Exempt RelativePath="/StyleSheets/.svn/" ExemptAllFiles="true" ExemptDescendantDirectories="true" SearchPatterns=""/> </ExemptLocations> <AdditionalLocations/> <CleanupExemptLocations> <CleanupExempt RelativePath="/prebuilt/aspnet_client/" ExemptAllFiles="true" ExemptDescendantDirectories="true" SearchPatterns="" IsFile="false"/> </CleanupExemptLocations> </ReplicationTarget>

member.summary: Retrieves the collection of Exempt Locations for this Replication Target, in a paginated fashion.
member.param: Total count of entries
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReplicationTarget.AddExemptLocation(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new Exempt Location to this replication target.
member.param: Path of exemption that is relative to the Publishing Target Folder
Whether to excude all Files in this location
The search pattern for Files that will be excluded. Only applies when the exemptAllFiles paramter value is false
Whether to exclude all descendant Directories of this location
member.returns: Newly added exempt location

remarks.para: The locationPath value doesn't have to point to the existing location when calling this method. However, if it still doesn't exist during replication, an error will be thrown.

member.exception: When location path is null or empty

member.summary: Adds a new Additional Location to this replication target.
member.param: Absolute path of the source Directory to be copied to the replication destination
The relative path of the replication destination to the content of the source path

remarks.para: Both "sourcePath" and "targetPath" don't have to exist when calling this method. However, if they still don't exist during replication, an error will be thrown.

member.summary: Adds a new Cleanup Exempt Location to this replication target.

Whether to excude all Files in this location from cleanup
The search pattern for Files that will be excluded from cleanup. Only applies when the exemptAllFiles paramter value is false

member.returns: Newly added Cleanup Exempt Location

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReplicationTarget.ClearExemptionAndAdditionalLocations
member.summary: Removes all Exempt, Additional and Cleanup Exempt locations.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReplicationTarget.Replicate
member.summary: Performs replication on this target.

remarks.para: Replication generates two logs: the execution log and the completion log.
Execution logs are placed at App_Data/pub/__Replication__/[publishing target folder]/logs. All replication targets of the Replicator will be placed in one log file.
Completion logs are places at App_Data/pub/__Replication__/Logs. This log is in XML format. Each replication target has its own log file.
Replication logs any errors that occurred when replicating individual items and continues the process unless a stopping error occurred.
Stopping errors are critical errors that halt replication. They are tracked in both logs

member.returns: The Monitor object to track the status of replication

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.IReplicationTarget.CleanReplicate
member.summary: Performs a replication that removes all Files from the replication destination that no longer exist in the Publishing Target Folder.

remarks.para: Replication generates two logs: the execution log and the completion log.
Execution logs are placed at App_Data/pub/__Replication__/[publishing target folder]/logs. All replication targets of the Replicator are placed in one log file.
Completion logs are places at App_Data/pub/__Replication__/Logs. This log is in XML format. Each replication target has its own log file.
Replication logs any errors that occurred when replicating individual items and continues this process unless a stopping error occurred.
Stopping errors are critical errors that halt replication. They are tracked in both logs

member.returns: The Monitor object to track the status of replication

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema
member.summary: Represents a schema for a page. All pages in the Ingeniux CMS are created from a schema, which defines page structure. However, changes to a schema are not automatically applied to pages created from it. In order for a page's structure to stay in sync with a schema, you must sync it in schema designer.

example.para: Schemas are retrieved by the SchemaByID, SchemaByFriendlyName, and SchemaByRootName methods of the SchemaManager object.
Schemas are created with the CreateSchema or CreateComponentSchema method of the SchemaManager object, or they are imported from XML schema content with the ImportSchema method.
A schema's serialization output matches schema files in previous-generation CMS content:
example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <Schema name="AtoZIndex" xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:xml-data" xmlns:dt="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:datatypes"> <AttributeType dt:type="id" name="ID" required="yes" /> <AttributeType dt:type="string" name="Name" required="yes" /> <AttributeType default="8" dt:type="int" name="Icon" /> <AttributeType default="A to Z Index" dt:type="string" name="FriendlyName" /> <AttributeType default="true" dt:type="boolean" name="SS" /> <AttributeType default="default.xsl" dt:type="string" name="DefaultStyleSheet" /> <AttributeType default="" dt:type="string" name="DefaultCategorization" /> <AttributeType name="Version" dt:type="int" default="1" /> <AttributeType name="UniqueID" dt:type="int" default="57" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" name="Exports" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="Title" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="Abstract" /> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowergroupstart_SEOGroup" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="NavName"> <description>The text used for links in site navigations. Defaults on page creation to the title.</description> </ElementType> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="BrowserBarTitle" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="MetaDescription" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="MetaKeywords" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="enumeration" name="Priority" values=".9 .8 .7 .6 .5 .4 .3 .2 .1" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="boolean" name="NoFollow" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="boolean" name="NoIndex" /> <ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="boolean" name="NoODP" /> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowergroupend" /> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="dhtml_BodyCopy" /> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowertaxonomynavigation_ExclusionCategory"> <description>Select a category that will exclude tagged items from the A-Z index</description> </ElementType> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowernavigation_AncestorNavigation" /> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowercomponent_SiteControl" /> <ElementType content="eltOnly" name="AtoZIndex" order="seq"> <attribute type="ID" /> <attribute type="Name" /> <element hidden="false" label="Title" readonly="false" required="true" type="Title" /> <element hidden="false" label="Abstract" readonly="false" required="true" type="Abstract" /> <element Expanded="false" hidden="true" label="SEO Group" readonly="false" required="false" type="xpowergroupstart_SEOGroup" /> <element hidden="false" label="Navigation Name" readonly="false" required="false" type="NavName" /> <element hidden="false" label="Browser Bar Title" readonly="false" required="false" type="BrowserBarTitle" /> <element hidden="false" label="Meta Description" readonly="false" required="false" type="MetaDescription" /> <element hidden="false" label="Meta Keywords" readonly="false" required="false" type="MetaKeywords" /> <element hidden="false" label="Priority" readonly="false" required="false" type="Priority" /> <element hidden="false" label="No Follow" readonly="false" required="false" type="NoFollow" /> <element hidden="false" label="No Index" readonly="false" required="false" type="NoIndex" /> <element hidden="false" label="No ODP" readonly="false" required="false" type="NoODP" /> <element type="xpowergroupend" /> <element hidden="false" label="Body Copy" readonly="false" required="false" type="dhtml_BodyCopy" /> <element Depth="" FilterParentPages="" FilterSchemas="" IncludePages="false" StartNodes="" hidden="false" label="Exclusion Category" readonly="false" required="false" type="xpowertaxonomynavigation_ExclusionCategory" /> <element Expanded="false" GenerationOrder="down" MaxDepth="" MaxNodes="" Navigation="Ancestors" Query="" StartPage="x2" hidden="true" label="Ancestor Navigation" readonly="true" required="false" type="xpowernavigation_AncestorNavigation" /> <element CompTypes="SiteControl" Component="x10" hidden="true" label="Site Control" readonly="true" required="false" type="xpowercomponent_SiteControl" /> </ElementType> </Schema>

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic
member.summary: Represents the properties shared by the Schema and SchemaVersion objects.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.FieldsCount
member.summary: Gets the count of fields in this schema.
member.returns: Count of fields.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Fields
member.summary: Gets the collection of fields in this schema.
member.returns: Collection of schema fields in its natural order.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Field(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a schema field by its name.
member.param: Name of the field. All schema field names must be valid XML element names.
member.returns: Field with matching name. If matching name doesn't exist, returns null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Field(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a schema field by its positional index.
member.param: Position of the field
member.returns: Field as the given position. If this position is out of range, returns null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.AddField(Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaField,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new schema field to the collection, either at the specified position or at the end.
member.param: New schema field to add
Position at which to insert this field.. If missing, appends new field to end of collection.
member.returns: The index of the added field. If insertPosition is not specified, it will be the position of last field.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.RemoveField(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes from the collection a schema field at a specified index.
member.param: Position of the schema field to remove
member.returns: True if the field exists at given position, false if the position of out of range.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.ClearFields
member.summary: Clears all Fields from the collection.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.DefaultCategories
member.summary: Retrieves the default categories collection for pages created with this schema. When page is created, these categories are automaticaly applied to the page.
member.returns: Collection of default categories

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.DefaultCategoriesCount
member.summary: Gets the count of default categories.
member.returns: Count of default categories.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.ClearDefaultCategories
member.summary: Clear all default categories.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.AddDefaultCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode)
member.summary: Adds a new default category.
member.param: New category to add as default category
member.remarks: If the CategoryNode already exists in the collection, nothing happens.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.RemoveDefaultCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode)
member.summary: Removes a default category.
member.param: Default category to remove
member.returns: True if a category with a matching ID exists in the collection. Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.AllowedCategoryRoots
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of categories. Categories and their descendants in this collection are allowed to be associated with pages created with this schema.
member.returns: Collection of allowed root categories.

remarks.para: When this property is empty, all categories are allowed to be associated with pages created with this schema.
Note that any categories, not just categories that are roots in the tree, must be added in this list.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.AllowedCategoryRootsCount
member.summary: Gets the count of allowed root categories.
member.returns: Count of allowed root categories.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.ClearAllowedCategoryRoots
member.summary: Clears all allowed root categories.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.AddAllowedRootCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode)
member.summary: Adds a new root category to the allowed root categories collection.
member.param: New category to add as an allowed root
member.remarks: If the category already exists in collection, nothing happens.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.RemoveAllowedRootCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode)
member.summary: Removes a category from the the allowed root categories collection.
member.param: The allowed root category to remove
member.returns: True if the category exists in collection, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Drafting
member.summary: Gets whether the schema is in drafting state. When a schema is in drafting state, it cannot be used for page creation.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.FriendlyName
member.summary: Gets and sets the schema's friendly name.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.RootName
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the schema's root element.
member.remarks: Root element name must be a valid XML element name
member.exception: When trying to set this property with a null, empty, or whitespace value
When trying to set this property with a string that contains illegal characters for an XML element name

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.IsComponent
member.summary: Gets and sets whether this schema is for a component page.
member.remarks: When a page is a component, it doesn't have views (visual templates) associated with it.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Icon
member.summary: Gets and sets the icon of the page to be created with this schema.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.IsDynamicSitePage
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the page to be created from this schema is a Dynamic Site Server page or a traditional XSLT page. Dynamic Site Server pages are not required to have stylesheet values.

remarks.para: On a Dynamic Site Server (Run-time) site, the rendering engine first searches for the view that matches either the value of ViewName, or the RootName of page document. If view doesn't exist for either case, it tries to fall back to stylesheet. Setting this property to true only means it is not needed to set the stylesheet property; it doesn't mean we cannot set it.
Also, setting it to true doesn't mean that the ViewName property is required.
The purpose of this property is for visual presentation only in the CMS schema designer user interface.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.ViewName
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of this page type's MVC view.

remarks.para: This property is not required, regardless of whether IsDynamicSitePage is set to true or false. The view name always falls back to RootName if value of this property is null or empty.
This property instructs the Dynamic Site Server rendering engine to choose a different view name rather than using the root name of the page XML document.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Stylesheet
member.summary: Gets and sets the entry XSLT style sheet name, located in the "xml/stylesheets" folder.

remarks.para: This property is not required, even if IsDynamicSitePage is set to false.
If no view is found that matches either property, however, not setting it means that the Dynamic Site Server rendering engine outputs XML. ViewName or RootName.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.WorkflowRequired
member.summary: Gets and sets whether pages created via this schema are added to a workflow after creation. If this property is set to true, the WorkflowDefinition property must be set to a valid workflow definition. Otherwise, validation will fail.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.WorkflowDefinition
member.summary: Gets and sets the workflow defintion for this schema. If set, pages created with this schema will be added to a workflow based on this defintion right away.
member.remarks: This property is required, if WorkflowRequired is true. If not set in that case, schema will not pass data validation before saving.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Errors
member.summary: Gets any errors associated with this schema.
member.remarks: Reserved for migrated legacy schemas from previous-generation CMS content.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.OriginPage
member.summary: Gets the page that updated or created this schema. This page will always be a page with presentations.
member.remarks: Pages with presentations are allowed to update or create new schemas with presentation information included.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.Presentations
member.summary: Gets the schema's presentations collection, which is applied to all pages created from this schema.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaBasic.ContentUnitsInstantiability
member.summary: Gets the collection of information on whether a Content Unit can be instantiated, and how many times it can be instantiated.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.Versions(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the schema's history, which is a collection of all its previous versions, in a paginated fashion.
member.param: Output total count of entries.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from first entry.
member.returns: Collection of previous versions.
member.remarks: Schema manager has a versions limit setting, which allows automatically cleans up older versions of schemas to keep the number of previous versions under the limit. Therefore, this collection may not be the entire history of this schema.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.VersionsCount
member.summary: Gets the count of previous versions for this schema.
member.returns: Count of versions

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.Version(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a previous version of this schema by its version number.
member.param: Version number to retrieve
member.returns: Previous version with matching version number. If version number is out of range, returns null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.UpdateContent(System.Xml.Linq.XDocument)
member.summary: Updates the schema with provided XML content and saves the schema in draft mode. If new content doesn't have a matching root name and friendly name, it will not be accepted.
member.param: New content of schema XML
member.exception: When the document has invalid schema XML

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves this schema.
member.param: Whether to save the schema
member.remarks: If saveNewVersion is true, a previous version will be created, and this schema is allowed to create pages. If not, a previous version will not be created, and this schema will be in draft mode and cannot be used to create pages.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.IsSystemSchema
member.summary: Checks whether this Schema is an essential schema that comes with default CMS instance.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.CurrentVersion

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.CurrentVersionNumber
member.summary: Gets the version number of the current version.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchema.RuntimeIndexable
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the Schema should be indexed at Runtime. This property will instruct the Runtime content indexing system for searches, to include the Schema for indexing or not.
member.remarks: This property only applies for Page Schemas. On Component Schemas

member.remarks: This collection is built into the system and cannot be changed.
member.example:
Below is the full collection of the field types in XML format:

prefix="xpowerlist" icon="group16"/> <Field id="6" EnumId="4" name="Link" type="" prefix="xpowerlink" icon="link16" hasExport="true"/> <Field id="7" EnumId="5" name="Insert" type="" prefix="xpowerinsert" icon="insert16"/> <Field id="8" EnumId="6" name="Navigation" type="" prefix="xpowernavigation" icon="navigation16" hasExport="true"/> <Field id="9" EnumId="13" name="Checkbox" type="boolean" prefix="" icon="check16"/> <Field id="10" EnumId="22" name="Date" type="date" prefix="" icon="datetime16"/> <Field id="11" EnumId="21" name="Dropdown List" type="enumeration" prefix="" icon="dropdown16"/> <Field id="12" EnumId="26" name="Image File" type="imagefile" prefix="" icon="image16"/> <Field id="13" EnumId="27" name="Media File" type="mediafile" prefix="" icon="media16"/> <Field id="14" EnumId="28" name="Document" type="document" prefix="" icon="document16"/> <Field id="15" EnumId="15" name="GroupStart" type="" prefix="xpowergroupstart" icon="group16"/> <Field id="16" EnumId="16" name="GroupEnd" type="" prefix="xpowergroupend" icon="group16"/> <Field id="17" EnumId="8" name="ComExecute" type="" prefix="xpowercomexecute" icon="comcomponent16"/> <Field id="18" EnumId="11" name="JavaExecute" type="" prefix="xpowerjavaexecute" icon="javacomponent16" /> <Field id="19" EnumId="25" name="Multi-Select: Hard-coded choices" type="multiselect" prefix="" icon="dropdown16"/> <Field id="20" EnumId="25" name="Multi-Select: Choices from Database Query" type="multiselect" prefix="" icon="dropdown16"/> <Field id="21" EnumId="25" name="Multi-Select: Choices from CMS node-set" type="multiselect" prefix="" icon="dropdown16"/> <Field id="22" EnumId="25" name="Multi-Select: Choices from external scripting" type="multiselect" prefix="" icon="dropdown16"/> member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaFieldResult
member.summary: Represents the combination of a SchemaField's serialization result. It contains 3 pieces of xml to go to 2 different areas in the final Schema xml output

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaFieldResult.IsAttribute
member.summary: Gets whether the field output is for an attribute field.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaFieldResult.Declaration
member.summary: Gets the declaration element of the field

example.para: Depending whether the field is an attribute or an element, there are two types of declaration results:
Attribute field output:
Element field output:
example.code: <ElementType name="Title" dt:type="string" content="textOnly"/> <ElementType name="xpowernavigation_AncestorNavigation" content="eltOnly"/> <ElementType name="xpowercomponent_SiteControl" content="eltOnly"/>

member.remarks: Attribute field output is always a standard data type with the "dt:type" attribute. Element field output can be standard "dt:type", or XPower type with an XPower prefix like "xpowercomponent_".

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaFieldResult.ChildDeclaration
member.summary: Gets the declaration of child element of the field. Only applies to List elements. The serialization format is identical to that of the Element type field.

summary.para: Gets the field's implementation element. Implementation elements are used to include details about the field and where it is placed in the page XML.
Implementation elements are always stored in the Declaration element of the Root element of a page's schema.

example.para: Depending on whether the field is an attribute or an element, there are two types of implementation results:
Attribute implementation output:
The "type" attribute value is the field name.
Element implementation output:
example.code: <element required="true" type="Title" readonly="false" label="Title" hidden="false"/> <element required="false" type="xpowernavigation_AncestorNavigation" readonly="true" label="Ancestor Navigation" hidden="true" Expanded="false" StartPage="x2" Query="" Navigation="Ancestors" MaxNodes="" MaxDepth="" GenerationOrder="down"/> <element required="false" type="xpowercomponent_SiteControl" readonly="true" label="Site Control" hidden="true" Component="x10" CompTypes="SiteControl"/>
example.para: Navigation element types may also contain an Exports element for local exports.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that provides means to query and managee schemas and schema field favorites. It also provides the built-in field definitions.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object and only work within that session.

example.para: There is a metadata XML file from previous-generation CMS content for schema manager; therefore, its output is simply the schema count.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaManager.CreateComponentSchema(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new component schema. This schema creates a component page, which doesn't have a fixed view associated with it.
member.param: The new schema's root element name, which must be a valid XML element name.
The new schema's friendly name. This can be any name you choose, but it's recommended that you limit its length.
An icon ID, which corresponds to an icon image.
member.returns: The newly created component schema.

remarks.para: The returned schema is not yet saved to the content store.
The "name" parameter provided cannot be null, empty, or whitespace, and it must be a valid XML element name.
The friendly names and root element names are unique to the schema's collection. If any schemas with a matching friendly name or root element name already exist, an error is thrown.
The newly created schema will be in draft mode. It cannot be used to create pages until it is saved with a new version.
If the icon ID provided doesn't match any icon images, it defaults to a blank page icon.
The newly created schema doesn't have any fields yet. Fields must be added to the returned object before saving (for more information, see UserWriteSession disposal).

member.exception: When the "name" parameter is null, empty or contains whitespace
When the "name" parameter is not a valid XML element name, or there are already schemas with the same root name or friendly name.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ISchemaManager.CreateSchema(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.Presentation.IPagePresentationCollection)
member.summary: Creates a new Schema. This can be either a page or component schema.
member.param: The new schema's root element name. This must be a valid XML element name.
The new schema's friendly name. This can be any name you choose, but it's recommended that you limit its length.
An icon ID, which corresponds to an icon image.
If true, the schema creates a component. If false, it creates a page.
Specifies whether page this schema creates will render using MVC views or XSLT style sheets. Has no effect if "isComponent" is true.
Specifies the view or XSLT style sheet file name for the pages created from this schema. If "isViewPage" is true, it will be the view name; otherwise, it will be the XSLT entry style sheet file name.
Specifies the presentations collection that is applied to pages created from this schema.
member.returns: The newly created schema.

remarks.para: The schema returned is not yet saved to the content store.
The "name" paramter provided cannot be null, empty, or contain whitespace, and it must be a valid XML element name.
The friendly names and root element names are unique to the schema's collection. If any schemas with a matching friendly name or root element name already exist, an error is thrown.
The newly created schema will be in draft mode. It cannot be used to create pages until it is saved with a new version.
If the icon ID provided doesn't match any icon images, it defaults to a blank page icon.
The newly created schema doesn't have any fields yet. Fields must be added to the returned object before saving (for more information, see UserWriteSession disposal).

On a Dynamic Site Server (run-time) site, the rendering engine first searches for the view that matches either the value of ViewName, or the RootName of page document. If the view doesn't exist, it tries to fall back to the style sheet. isViewPage being true only means it is not needed to set the style sheet property; it doesn't mean you cannot set it.
Setting isViewPage to true doesn't mean that the ViewName property is required.
The purpose of this parameter is for visual presentation only in the CMS schema designer user interface.

member.exception: When the "name" parameter is null, empty, or contains whitespace.
When the "name" parameter is not a valid XML element name; there are already schemas with same root name or friendly name; or the view name or style sheet name is invalid.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ISiteBranding
member.summary:
Represents the site branding system, which defines cobranding at the server level. It is used only for XSLT rendering.
Each Site Branding entry corresponding to a presentation style collection. Site Branding at run time is determined by locating its search string on the request URL. If the search string is found on the request URL, site branding is applied.
In other words, site brandings allow for presentation style switching based on request URL, include host name, base URL, and query strings.

remarks.para: At run time, site branding information is included in the IGX_Info/XPRESS/Site element:
User agent brandings are managed by the Manager object.

member.example:
Site branding is retrieved from :
ISiteBranding siteBrand = session.SiteMap.Site("print");

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ISiteBranding.SiteGroup
member.summary: Gets and sets the group to which this site branding belongs. Optional.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.IUserAgent
member.summary:
Represents a user agent branding. This is a branding system used only for XSLT rendering.
User agent branding is used to define cobranding at the client level. Each user agent branding entry corresponds to a presentation style collection. User agent branding at run time is determined by locating its search string on the requested, browser-specific user agent string. If the search string is found on the requested user agent, then this user agent branding is applied.
Creating user agent brandings allows presentation style switching based on browser type. This is mainly used for mobile-device detection.

remarks.para: At run time, the information of applied user agent branding is included in the IGX_Info/XPRESS/USER_AGENT element:
User agent brandings are managed by the manager object.

member.example:
User agent brandings are retrieved from :
IUserAgent siteBrand = session.SiteMap.UserAgent("mobile");

member.summary: Gets and sets the type of content this user agent should present.

member.remarks: This property is reserved for MFO publish only. It doesn't apply to normal requests.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode

summary.para: Represents one CategoryNode in the Taxonomy tree.
Categories are used to tag Page objects, creating another way to organize and index Page objects.
The Taxonomy system is hierarchical. Each CategoryNode may have parent and children nodes.

remarks.para: CategoryNode instances are retrieved from TaxonomyManager:

member.example:
Example of XML serialization for a CategoryNode "Animalia"
<C ID="198" N="Animalia" D="Animals Category" EID="G2374D-T948975" T="Kingdom" locale="en-us" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20130815T16:24:08" />

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.Depth
member.summary: Gets the hierarchy depth of this CategoryNode, starting from the root CategoryNode.
member.returns: Depth level
member.remarks: Root category node depth is 0. The depth value for a descendant node is how many ancestors away it is from the root category.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent CategoryNode of this node.
member.returns: If it is a root node, it returns null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.Path
member.summary: Gets the path of this CategoryNode.
member.returns: Path string is delimited by greater-than characters (">").
member.example: Life Forms>Animalia>Chordata>Mammal

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.Permissions
member.summary: Gets the permissions of this CategoryNode.
member.returns: Collection of permissions. If no permission is defined at any level, it will be one entry of for "Everyone".

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.AddPermission(Ingeniux.CMS.INodeLevelPermission)
member.summary: Adds a new permission to this CategoryNode.
member.param: Permission with both information and access type.
member.remarks: If this CategoryNode was inheriting permissions before, this action will cause it to have its own permissions. Its descendants inherit its permissions by default.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.AddPermissions(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingeniux.CMS.INodeLevelPermission})
member.summary: Adds a collection of new permissions to this CategoryNode.
member.param: Permissions with both information and access type.
member.remarks: If this CategoryNode inherits, this action causes it to have its own permissions. Its descendants will inherit its permissions by default.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.RemovePermission(Ingeniux.CMS.IUserGroup)
member.summary: Remove a UserGroup's permission entries from this CategoryNode.
member.param: UserGroup from which to remove permissions. Note that if the parameter value is null, nothing will happen.
member.returns: True if this CategoryNode doesn't inherit permissions and permission entry for the group exists. Otherwise, this method returns false.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.AllowAccess(Ingeniux.CMS.IUser,Ingeniux.CMS.Enums.EnumNodeLevelPermission)
member.summary: Check if a given is allowed the type of access specified.
member.param: User on whom to check access level.
Type of access to check for.
member.returns: True if the highest permission level of all groups this user belongs to is greater than or equal to the given permission. Otherwise, this method returns false.
member.remarks: Please note that if the accessType parameter value is , this method will always return true, regardless of whether there are any permissions defined for groups the user belongs to.

member.remarks: If this CategoryNode inherits its permissions, this method returns 0.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.TypeName
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the category type under the current locale.
member.remarks: When is , this method gets and sets . Otherwise, it will get and set the Translated Description under .
member.example:
TypeName is normally associated with category depth.
For example, in biological classifications, the categories "Monera," "Fungi," "Protista," "Plantae," and "Animalia" have the type name "Kingdom." The categories "Chordata," "Mollusca," and "Phoronida"â€”located under the kingdom "Animalia"â€”have the type name "Phylum."
Within the Ingeniux taxonomy system, however, this property is free form and can have any information or meaning.

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.Description

member.remarks: When is , this method gets and sets ; Otherwise, it gets and sets the Translated Description under .

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.OriginalTypeName

member.remarks: This property's value is the value with which the CategoryNode was created. It is the value under .

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode.OriginalDescription

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager
member.summary: Represents the manager object that provides a means to query and manage Category Nodes collections. ITaxonomyManager also manages the associations between pages and categories.

remarks.para: Like all manager objects, instances of this manager are retrieved from an object, and it only works within that session.

member.example:
Below is a serialization example that, except for the modification information in the root element, matches the TaxonomyTree.xml file from previous-generation CMS Sites:

the Category" FullName="ID" TagName="ID" /> <Definition Description="The ID for the category that is imported form another source (Optional)" FullName="External ID" TagName="EID" /> <Definition Description="The name of the Category" FullName="Name" TagName="N" /> <Definition Description="The description of the category" FullName="Description" TagName="D" /> <Definition Description="The name of classification type for this level of category node (Optional)" FullName="Classification Type" TagName="T" /> <Definition Description="Last updated date" FullName="LastUpdatedDate" TagName="LUD" /> <Definition Description="Last update user" FullName="LastUpdateUser" TagName="LUU" /> </Definitions> <Tree> <C ID="Categories/128" N="News" D="News" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\ashley" LUD="20081201T17:59:13"> <C ID="Categories/142" N="Admissions" D="Admissions" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20120330T09:53:41"> </C> <C ID="Categories/187" N="Alumni" D="Alumni" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20100427T11:53:58" /> </C> <C ID="Categories/127" N="Departments" D="Departments" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20100427T11:50:01"> <C ID="Categories/137" N="Math" D="Math" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\ashley" LUD="20091102T11:05:31" /> <C ID="Categories/138" N="Biology" D="Biology" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\neggen" LUD="20091203T07:11:40" /> <C ID="Categories/151" N="Physics" D="Physics" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\neggen" LUD="20091203T06:58:29" /> <C ID="Categories/179" N="Business" D="Business" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20100427T11:50:27" /> <C LUD="20100427T11:51:02" /> <C ID="Categories/182" N="French" D="French" EID="" T="" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20100427T11:51:37" /> <C ID="Categories/183" N="German" D="German" EID="" T="" member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.Associate(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode[])
member.summary: Associates a Page with a given collection of Category Nodes.
member.param: Page to associate
Category node collection to associate with the page

remarks.para: The "page" parameter value cannot be null. Otherwise, an error is thrown.
The "categories" parameter ignores all null values in the colleciton, but all the categories must be from the current session. Otherwise, an error is thrown.
The current user must either be an administrator or have permissions to manage the taxonomy system. Otherwise an error is thrown.
The current user must have full access to the page node and at least read-only access to provided categories. Otherwise, an error is thrown.

member.exception: When the "page: parameter is null
When any of the categories are not from this session.
When user doesn't have rights to manage taxonomy; doesn't have full acess to page; or doesn't have at least read-only access to any of the categories.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.UnassociatePage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Clears all categorization from a Page .
member.param: Page from which to clear all categorization.
member.remarks: If the page parameter is null, nothing happens.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CategoriesOnPage(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a paginated list of all the Category Nodes that are associated with a given Page.
member.param: Page on which to retrieve categorization information.
Total count of all category associations on the page.
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of of Category Node.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CategoriesOnPageCount(Ingeniux.CMS.IPage)
member.summary: Gets the count of Category Nodes that are asssociated with the specified Page.
member.param: Page on which to get category association count.
member.returns: Count of category associations.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.Category(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a Category Node by its unique ID.
member.param: ID of the category node to retrieve.
member.returns: The category node with matching ID. If it doesn't exist, returns null.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CopyCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode,Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies a Category Node and its descendants, and places the copy as child or sibling of another Category Node.
member.param: The category node to copy. Cannot be null.
The category node under which to place the copy. If null, the copy will be placed as a new root category.
Specifies whether the copy is placed as a child or as a sibling of the target node. If the target node is null, this parameter has no effect.
Specifies whether the copy includes all the category node's descendants.
member.returns: The copy that was placed at the correct location

remarks.para: The copy returned is not yet stored in the database.

The operating user must have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System. This user must also have at least read-only permissions on the source category and full access to the target cateogry. (If the target category is null, the user's permissions don't matter.)
There is no concept of orders in the taxonomy tree.

member.exception: When the operating user doesn't have permissions to Manage Taxonomy System; doesn't have read-only access to the source node; or doesn't have full access to the target node.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.MoveCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode,Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes a Category Node a child or sibling of another Category Nodee, or turns it into a Root Node.
member.param: The category node to move.
The category node at which to place the moved node. If null, the moved node becomes a root node.
Specifies whether the moved node is placed as a child or as a sibling of the target node. If the target node is null, this parameter has no effect.
member.returns: The moved category node as its new location

remarks.para: The moved node is not yet stored in the database.
The operating user must have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System. This user must also have full access to both the source category and target cateogry.
There is no concept of orders in the taxonomy tree.

member.exception: When operating user doesn't have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System or doesn't have full access to both the source node and the target node.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CreateCategory(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode)
member.summary: Creates a new Category Node under another Category Node.
member.param: Name of new category
Description of new category
External ID of new category (for integration with another taxonomy system)
Type name of new category
Parent node under which to place the new category; if not listed, creates new node as root category
member.returns: Newly created category.

remarks.para: When the new Category Node is returned, it has not yet been stored in the database.
The operating user must have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System and also have full access to the specified parent node.
The taxonomy tree doesn't have the concept of orders.
The of the new category is the value of the property.

member.exception: When the operating user doesn't have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System or full access to parent node.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CreateRootCategory(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Root Category Node.
member.param: Name of new category
Description of new category
External ID of new category (for integration with another taxonomy system)
Type name of new category
member.returns: Newly created toot category

remarks.para: When the new node is returned, it has not yet been stored in the database.
The operating user must have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System.
The taxonomy tree doesn't have the concept of orders.
The of the new category is the value of the property.

member.exception: When operating user doesn't have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.RemoveCategory(Ingeniux.CMS.ICategoryNode)
member.summary: Removes a Category Node from the content store. This also removes any associations this Category has with any Pages.
member.param: The category to remove. If null, returns false.
member.returns: True if category exists, false if it doesn't.

remarks.para: Category is permanently removed after this method is called.
Category removal occurs when session closes.
The operating user must have rights to Manage Taxonomy System and full access to the category to be removed.

member.exception: When the operating user doesn't have the rights to Manage Taxonomy System or doesn't have full access to the category to be removed.

Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of root category node instances
member.remarks: Root categories are categories without parents.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.RootCategoriesCount
member.summary: Gets the count of all Root Categories.

member.remarks: When this method returns 0, it means there are no categories in the taxonomy system.

member.returns: Collection of category node instances

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.Categories(System.Int32@,Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Gets Category Nodes by initial characters in name, filtered by locale, in a paginated fashion.
This is the main way of searching for categories. By default, it returns all categories with all input parameters missing.

member.param: Total count of all matching categories
The locale in which to search. If missing or null, uses the taxonomy manger's current locale.
The initial characters to search for in a category name. If the locale is not the creation locale of a category, searches translated name for that locale.
Specifies whether or not to search synonyms
Number of entries to return. If not provided, returns all entries.
Starting index of entries. If not provided, starts from the first entry.
member.returns: Collection of category node instances matching the criteria.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CategoriesCount(System.String,Ingeniux.CMS.ILocale,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the count of Category Nodes by initial characters in name, filtered by locale.
member.param: The initial characters to search for in a category name. If the locale is not the category's creation locale, searches the translated name for that locale.
The locale in which to search. If missing or null, uses the taxonomy manager's current locale.
Specifies whether to search synonyms.
member.returns: Count of categories matching the criteria.

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.ITaxonomyManager.CategoriesCount
member.summary: Gets the count of all Category Nodes.
member.returns: Count of all categories.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <TaxonomyAssociations> <Definitions> <Definition Description="The Association between category and page" FullName="Association" TagName="A" /> <Definition Description="The category id" FullName="CategoryID" TagName="C" /> <Definition Description="The page XID associated with certain category" FullName="Page XID" TagName="P" /> <Definition Description="Last Updated Date" FullName="LastUpdatedDate" TagName="LUD" /> <Definition Description="Last Update User" FullName="LastUpdateUser" TagName="LUU" /> </Definitions> <Associations> <A C="Categories/132" P="x27" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20081215T11:48:05" /> <A C="Categories/130" P="x34" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20081215T11:48:09" /> <A C="Categories/131" P="x35" LUU="ingeniux\awang" LUD="20081215T11:48:18" /> </Associations> </TaxonomyAssociations>

member.summary: Returns the XML presentation of the Taxonomy Tree

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.ChoicesProviderOptions
member.summary: Contains information on how the choices for a enumerative element should be presented.

member.name: F:Ingeniux.CMS.ChoicesProviderOptions.Filter
member.summary: If the client requests that the data be filtered (typically by matching a "starts-with" test of the value), then this property holds the string to be tested against. If this option is left unchanged, the system filters the results. The developer has the option to apply the filter here, after which the filter property should be changed to be an empty string or a Boolean false, so that the system does not try to apply the filter again. This option is available to apply more-efficient filtering techniques (such as a SQL "WHERE" clause, in the case of selecting from a database). This option applies only to Multiselect Elements, not Enumeration Elements.

member.name: F:Ingeniux.CMS.ChoicesProviderOptions.Validate
member.summary: True by default. This option instructs the system to remove empty values from the list before the response is sent to the client. The validate property can be set to false in order to disable this behavior and potentially increase performance. This option applies only to Multiselect Elements, not Enumeration Elements.

member.name: F:Ingeniux.CMS.ChoicesProviderOptions.PageId
member.summary: This input can be used to determine the page for which the client is requesting data. This allows the developer to return different data based on page ID (example: "x123") This option applies to both Multiselect Elements and Enumeration Elements.

member.name: T:Ingeniux.CMS.RavenDocumentSession
member.summary: This override class expose the protected member of document session to allow further level of manipulations Used by UserSession to track captured objects, or manipulate them manually

member.name: M:Ingeniux.CMS.RavenDocumentSession.SaveChangesAndFinalize
member.summary:
This is the method must be called to close a session and prevent it from taking anymore actions Once it is called, it cannot be called again. Session itself will also be disposed.
This method should be saved as the very last method to call on a session. All queries and loads should be done before this one

member.name: P:Ingeniux.CMS.RavenDocumentSession.RanOutOfReadsQuota
member.summary: Use this property to make sure number of request is 1 short of max requests allowed Any full list loading or query must check this one to decide if to open up a new one
